docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The Twin Furies are located in the Heart of Gielinor, the duo consists of Nymora (left) and Avaryss (right). Entering the encounter requires 40 (or 20, with enough reputation) kill count, and 80 (boostable) Ranged . This encounter is unique in that both NPC’s share the same health pool of 200k. This means that an AoE attack will essentially do double damage if it hits both twins.

​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text:
Jumps ⬥ Avaryss jumps towards the northern wall and charges down to the southern wall. She will repeat this attack a total of 4 times and will always travel in the cardinal directions (north to south, west to east, etc.).     • You may simply move out of the way after Avaryss jumps to a new wall. Example Ceiling Collapse ⬥ Nymora will jump to a random square and cause a ceiling collapse.     • Stand in the 3x3 area around her to negate this. Example Channeled Bomb ⬥ The twins move to the center of the arena and channel an attack. Example ⬥ If the channel finishes, it will deal 4,500 damage. Example ⬥ During this phase, the twins take 2x damage     • They stand close enough that Cleave , Hurricane , and Quake will hit both of them.     • You will take typeless damage during this (negated by Soul Split ).     • Can be avoided by surging to the edges of the arena, (or blocking it with defensives).

​

docs.title: The Fight
docs.text:
⬥ You must continually move out of Avaryss' path (≥2 steps perpendicular).

⬥ It is possible to wrongly Target Cycle onto Avaryss. Manually click on Nymora if this happens.

⬥ While hits show, they don't deal damage. Therefore, is not used.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
Below are some presets we believe will lead to a great learning experience.

​

Melee and Necromancy will be the easiest to learn with. These are all not set in stone so if you are missing a couple of items, you will still be able to complete kills. Try not to downgrade too heavily though as these have been prepared with your learning experience in mind.

Preset Suggestions ⬥ Melee preset ⬥ Necromancy preset

​

docs.title: Tips and Tricks
docs.text:
The Twin Furies are very unique in that they share a health pool, which means whenever they are close together, AoE abilities will hit them both and deplete their HP twice. This means using , and or , + , or , will be doubly effective versus single target abilities.

​

This is a great boss to learn how to use a few of your Defensive abilities effectively as well as familiarise yourself with movement during an encounter. Primarily in this fight, you can use Resonance , Devotion , or Reflect to reduce incoming damage, especially during the Ceiling Collapse and Jumps. If you have Lesser Bone Shield unlocked and active, you do not need to bring a shield with you to access Resonance or Reflect , otherwise you will need to bring a shield.

​

Twin Furies is also a great boss to practice some fundamentals when thinking about your abilities. Below is a basic structure to think about and practice:

​

1) Damage boosting ultimate ability ‎ ‎ /

2) Build adrenaline, souls or necrosis stacks using appropriate basic abilities

3) Stronger threshold abilities, e.g., / , / ,

4) Repeat steps 2 and 3 until your damage boosting ultimate ability runs out and build to 100% adrenaline again

5) Repeat from step 1

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
TzKal-Zuk is the general of the Ful Front of the Elder God Wars. This encounter is the third version of the Fight Caves/Fight Kiln, in that you fight waves of enemies before taking on the main boss.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic preset  ⬥ Melee preset  ⬥ Necromancy preset  ⬥ Ranged preset

docs.title: The Fight
docs.text:
This encounter has 17 waves of enemies, and then the final boss, TzKal-Zuk. Normal mode has checkpoints after waves 5, 10, 15, and 17. Hard mode has one checkpoint after wave 17. The arena has some ledges in it that can be used to lure/safespot various mobs.

General Wave Safespot

*1. Start at the southeast corner

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. There is a lava geyser here which can damage you, but isn’t much of a worry if you use animate dead

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b. You can move as far south as you can to attack mobs over the ledge

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎c. You can move to the east to dodge the wall of fire in hardmode

  1. There should only be 1-2 mobs that can attack you at a time.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. Kill them and move out to let some more mobs find you. Move back in once they are untrapped

  1. Repeat until the wave is cleared*

​

docs.title: Normal Waves (1-3, 7-8, 12-13) and Igneous Waves (4, 9, 14)
docs.text: NOTE: TzekHaar-Kih takes priority focus over everything.

docs.title: Waves 1-3
docs.text:
⬥ Wave 1: at 10 seconds TzekHaar-Kih will spawn south and southeast, kill them immediately.

⬥ Wave 2: focus Xil x2, kill remaining.

⬥ Wave 3: Kih > Xil, kill remaining.

docs.title: Waves 7-8
docs.text:
⬥ Wave 7: Kih > Tok-Xil x2, kill remaining.

⬥ Wave 8: Mej >Tok-Xil x6, kill remaining.

docs.title: Waves 12-13
docs.text:
⬥ Wave 12: Kih > Tok-Xil x2, Ket-Zek takes priority after Tok-Xil are dead, kill remaining.

⬥ Wave 13: Tok-Xil x2 > Ket-Zek takes priority after Tok-Xil are dead, kill remaining.

​

​

docs.title: Igneous Waves 4, 9, 14
docs.text:
⬥ 3 Large Igneous variants of mobs will spawn along with many normal versions of that mob

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Igneous TzekHaar-Hur

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Weaken by stunning, then kill normally.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Igneous TzekHaar-Xil

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Weaken by using a threshold or ultimate ability, then kill normally.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Igneous TzekHaar-Mej

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Weaken by standing in it's shield dome, then kill normally.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Only the 3 Igneous variants need to be killed. The rest of the mobs can be ignored.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ After killing the last Igneous mob of the wave, an extra action button will appear on your screen. Click that and attack TzKal-Zuk until you deal 50,000 damage to him.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎Note: If you fail to deal 50,000 damage to TzKal-Zuk, the phase repeats itself and you must do the remainder of the 50,000 damage to trigger the next phase

​

docs.title: Challenge Waves (5, 10, 15)
docs.text:
These waves are challenges for the player. They must be completed successfully to achieve a flawless run which unlocks hardmode, or in hardmode it grants the ability to make the tribrid cape.

​

docs.title: Wave 5
docs.text:
⬥ You must kill the 5 Volatile TzekHaar-Hur before the bar fills above their head.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Failure to do so will result in large typeless hits for each one left alive.

​

docs.title: Wave 10
docs.text:
⬥ You must kill the Unbreakable TzekHaar-Ket before the bar fills above its head.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Only hits that deal 3000+ damage will hurt this mob.

​

docs.title: Wave 15
docs.text:
⬥ You must survive several attacks from three Fatal TzekHaar-Yt-Hurkots. Each one attacks with a different combat style, and for a flawless run you must not take damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Barricade works for this.

​

docs.title: Wave 6
docs.text:
⬥ This is the first wave with a Jad. Kill it as soon as possible then focus on the other mobs.

​

docs.title: Waves 11 and 16
docs.text:
⬥ Wave 11 has 2 Jads and various mobs.

⬥ Wave 16 has 3 Jads but no other mobs.

Jad Wave Safespot

1. *Start at the northwest corner and kill Jad 1

  1. Clear out the extra mobs as needed (Wave 11)

  2. Move south to allow Jad 2 to attack you (yellow arrow)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. Jad 3 should get stuck behind Jad 2 and be unable to attack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b. For wave 11, Jad 2 doesn't exist so ignore this step

  1. Once Jad 2 is dead, move towards Jad 3 and kill it*

​

docs.title: Wave 17
docs.text:
⬥ This is the last enemy before fighting TzKal-Zuk. His head will appear for about 40 seconds when the wave starts. He has a lot of tentacles (Mage and Ranged) which will constantly attack dealing small damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After 40 seconds, his head will submerge for about 50 seconds, in which time you can kill some of the tentacles and use defensive abilities to mitigate some damage. You do not need to kill any tentacles finish the phase. Just the head needs to die.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He has a mechanic that shoots a blob to your location that drains your adrenaline by 10% immediately and makes you gain 50% reduced adrenaline for a short time.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ When his head is exposed, he only fires 1 blob at a time.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ When he submerges, he fires blobs that expand into a 5x5 X ‎shape at your players location. These can be dodge by moving out of the way.

​

docs.title: TzKal-Zuk
docs.text:
He primarily attacks with melee in melee distance, otherwise with magic.

Mechanics Zuk performs a mechanic after every 3 auto attacks in normal mode. The mechanics appear in order as follows, and will repeat once all mechanics have happened. Note: Zuk will skip the first 3 auto attacks and go into the Geothermal Burn mechanic as soon as the encounter starts. In addition, when Zuk hits 100k lifepoints, he will restart his attack rotation, starting with the Geothermal Burn. Geothermal Burn: ⬥ Zuk shouts You will break beneath me! and applies a magic bleed that lasts for 20 seconds.     • The bleed can be stopped by using Freedom . Sear ⬥ Zuk shouts Sear! or Suffer! and hits you with a melee hit and 2 magic hits, and lowers your constitution level.     • You need to travel 15 total tiles to stop the hp drain, and drink super restores to clear the debuff.     • This mechanic can be mostly negated instantly by using (Surge as soon as Zuk does the spec, which will be his 4th attack after the last spec, and running back to where you started. Quake ⬥ Zuk shouts Tremble before me! or Fall before my might! and causes the floor to crack in small areas around him that deal a lot of damage and apply an escalating magic bleed if stood in.     • This mechanic can be mostly negated instantly by using (Surge as soon as Zuk does the spec, which will be his 4th attack after the last spec, and attacking from your new location.     • Getting hit by any of the eruptions from the ground fissures will apply the same magic bleed from Geothermal Burn. However, your Freedom will still be on cooldown. Empowered Magic ⬥ Zuk shouts Die! Begone! or Ful's power flows through me! and shoots a projectile at you that deals high soft-typeless damage.     • You can use Disruption shield or Resonance to take 0 damage from this. Igneous Rain ⬥ Zuk shouts Flames consume you! or Burn! and jump to the middle of the room, becoming immune to attacks, stunning and dragging you, and covering all but one section of the arena with fire that ramps up damage the longer you stand in it.     • You can use Surge and Bladed Dive to get to the safe part of the arena, where an Igneous mob will be waiting for you to kill.     • Kill these the same way as in waves 4, 9, and 14. Use the extra action button to interrupt the mechanic. If you fail to interrupt it, it will instakill you. Basic Igneous Rain (''Pizza Phase'') Once Zuk is immune (1) → (2) / 120 degrees clockwise of current position → (3) defeat igneous mob → repeat steps 2/3 x2. Below is a general idea of what to use to defeat the igneous mobs. Magic ⬥ Hur: → → → improvise with basics ⬥ Xil: → → → improvise with basics ⬥ Mej: + run melee distance → → → improvise with basics Melee ⬥ Hur: → → improvise ⬥ Xil: → improvise ⬥ Mej: + run melee distance → improvise Ranged ⬥ Hur: → → improvise ⬥ Xil: → → improvise ⬥ Mej: + run melee distance → → improvise Note: Ensure you improvise with appropriate abilities so you can finish at 100% adrenaline in order to use ultimate as soon as possible.

docs.title: Example Kills
docs.text: Example Kills Magic ⬥ Basic Magic Run. Melee ⬥ Basic Melee Run. Ranged ⬥ Basic Ranged Run. Necromancy ⬥ TBD

docs.title: Voice guidance throughout the kill
docs.text:
This tool reads your screen, and based on certain lines of dialogue in your chatbox, will trigger and play voice lines during the kill to let you know about upcoming mechanics and what to do for them.

​

Disclaimer: Alt1 is a third party tool, and while generally safe to use, is still recommended to be installed and used at your own risk.

Alt1 TzKal-Zuk Helper Check out Igor's Presets and follow the download instructions there for Alt1 presets for this boss and more!

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Vindicta, the Zarosian general residing in the Heart of Gielinor, requires 80 attack (boostable) and 40 Zaros killcount to fight. Her drops include the t85 Dragon Rider Lance which disassembles for Ilujankan components needed for the Aftershock perk, and the Crest of Zaros which is used to make the t80 Anima Core of Zaros set

​

The fight itself is split into two distinct phases. The aim of this guide is to familiarise you with how to handle mechanics in order to successfully get your first solo kills.

​

Throughout this fight, Vindicta's auto attacks hit the player with melee damage. The player will pray Protect from Melee or Deflect Melee .

​

Phase 1 (200k - 100k hp): Attack Rotation Make sure to start the fight in the centre of the arena to avoid Vindicta skipping attacks 2 auto attacks → Hurricane OR Ranged special attack → 3 auto attacks → Dragonfire → 3 auto attacks → Hurricane → Repeat Hurricane ⬥ A 5x5 melee Area-of-Effect (AoE) attack is used when the player is within melee distance of Vindicta. The player should: • Pray Protect from Melee or Deflect Melee to mitigate 50% of its damage.     • (Optional) use Resonance to heal from this attack OR use Devotion to mitigate all the damage. • Click to view an example Hurricane ​ Ranged special attack ⬥ A ranged attack is used when the player is not in melee distance of Vindicta. ⬥ This is a single ranged hit for moderate damage. The player should: • Pray Protect from Missiles or Deflect Missiles to mitigate 50% of its damage. Then the player should return back to Protect from Melee or Deflect Melee .     • (Optional) Use Resonance to heal from this attack OR use Devotion to mitigate all the damage. Dragonfire ⬥ Vindicta raises her arms to signal Gorvek, her dragon. Gorvek then engulfs a straight line in flames targeted at the player from a random direction. ⬥ This attack deals small, rapid magic hits if stood in. The player should: • Move out of the dragonfire as quickly as they can. • If you find yourself standing in the fire, pray Protect from Magic or Deflect Magic and move out of the fire. Make sure to swap back to Protect from Melee or Deflect Melee after exiting the dragonfire. • Click to view an example Dragonfire attack ​ Phase 2 (100k - 0k hp): Attack Rotation ⬥ Melee auto attack → Ranged special attack → Melee auto attack → Dragonfire Wall → Repeat ​ Ranged special attack ⬥ This is a single ranged hit dealing high damage. The timing of this attack is dependent on how far away Gorvek lands after the dragonfire. If too far away, the first melee auto attack will be skipped and the Ranged special attack is immediate. You can surge/dive closer to Gorvek to help close the distance. The player should: • Use Resonance to heal from this attack.     • If Resonance is on cooldown, the player can perform one of the following options:         • Use Debilitate or Reflect to reduce incoming damage by 50%.         • Pray Protect from Missiles or Deflect Missiles to mitigate 50% of its damage and additionally use Devotion to mitigate all the damage. Remember to swap back afterwards! • Click to view an example Ranged special attack ​ Dragonfire Wall ⬥ Vindicta commands Gorvek to engulf a straight line in flames targeted at the player. ⬥ Other than Vindicta riding Gorvek and flying away, this is identical to the dragonfire during phase 1 and can be dealt with the same way - pray Protect from Magic or Deflect Magic and move out of the fire. • Click to view an example Dragonfire attack ​

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
Below are some presets we believe will lead to a great learning experience. Magic assumes the user is on the normal spellbook.

​

Necromancy and Magic will be the easiest to learn with however Melee and Ranged presets can be provided in #pvm-help. These are all not set in stone so if you are missing a couple of items, you will still be able to complete kills. Try not to downgrade too heavily though as these have been prepared with your learning experience in mind.

Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic preset ⬥ Necromancy preset

docs.title: Tips and Tricks
docs.text:
This is a great boss to learn how to use a few of your Defensive abilities effectively as well as familiarise yourself with movement during an encounter. Primarily in this fight, you will use Resonance , Devotion , Debilitate or Reflect to reduce incoming damage. If you have Lesser Bone Shield unlocked and active, you do not need to bring a shield with you to access Resonance or Reflect otherwise you will need to bring a shield.

​

Vindicta is also a great boss to practice some fundamentals when thinking about your abilities. Below is a basic structure to think about and practice:

​

1) Damage boosting ultimate ability / / /

2) Build adrenaline, souls or necrosis stacks using appropriate basic abilities

3) Stronger threshold abilities, e.g., / , / / , / , /

4) Repeat steps 2 and 3 until your damage boosting ultimate ability runs out and build to 100% adrenaline again

5) Repeat from step 1

Content Provided by: @achievementshunter

Formatting Maintained by: @achievementshunter

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Zamorak, Lord of Chaos is the fifth and final installment in the Elder God Wars dungeon. This guide will focus on the final boss encounter, at enrages less than 100%, for help clearing the dungeon refer to #Zamorakian Undercity, for a more detailed guide and higher enrage strategies refer to #Zamorak Main Guide.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic preset  ⬥ Melee preset  ⬥ Ranged preset

docs.title: Attack Rotation
docs.text:
Zamorak's damage and HP scales with enrage

⬥ Auto-attack cycle

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 Magic autos → 5 Ranged autos → Repeat (Special attacks get woven in)

⬥ Special attack cycle

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following diagram outlines the pattern of special attacks used by and how they vary based on when you transition between phases:

​

Special Attacks These are mechanics which will happen as you go around charging pads. Channelers ⬥ The message Zamorak begins to draw power and energy from something within Infernus. appears and a witch spawns in infernus which you must kill to charge the next pad.     • Press extra ability button.     • / and towards and kill witch.     • Press extra ability button to return to Zamorak. Then walk the next pad you want to charge. ​ Flames of Zamorak ⬥ Zamorak says The world will burn. and slams his wings into the ground, dealing 2 heavy melee hits.     • Step into melee distance of Zamorak, use (use defensives if low hp)     • Generally, the smoke will go to the Eastern most player.     • If any black smoke is absorbed, use defensives to mitigate damage. ​ Chaos Blast ⬥ Zamorak says I will tear you asunder! and wraps his wings around himself, with a blue bar appearing overhead.     • He sends a red smoke after you after you stun him and deal a specified amount of damage. The longer he charges the attack the more powerful the red smoke hits.     • Stun Zamorak to disrupt the blue bar. ⬥ He then says Feel the rage of a god.     • Use / / before the red smoke hits you. ​ ⬥Fully channelled Chaos Blast releases with an auto that counts towards the 5 or 11 auto set. If a chaos blast is stunned and releases before the channel is finished, it will not release this auto and do the full set after the mechanic finishes. Infernal Tomb ⬥ Zamorak says Step into the dark... meet your death., stunning you and sending to infernus while charging a blue bar.     • He sends a red smoke after you after you stun him. The longer he charges the attack the more powerful the red smoke hits.     • / to avoid stun, and as screen turns black use a stun.         ⬩ You will only be hit with a weak attack shortly after entering infernus if done correctly.     • towards and kill the demon by using a strong threshold and basic.     • Match overhead rune with one on top of a pad and / onto it.         ⬩ Matching the wrong rune will make you take heavy damage.     • Note: If you didn't stun properly while entering, stun Zamorak ASAP after exiting infernus and stack defensives to mitigate a more powerful Chaos Blast. Example clip of proper stun timing here. ​ Adrenaline Cage ⬥ Zamorak says Chaos, unfettered!, dropping all overhead prayers and hits the base with a few attacks soon after.     • Stand still. You will take additional damage when further away from the original tile where Zamorak cast the attack.     • Base as soon as possible. ​ Rune of Destruction ⬥ Zamorak says You're already dead. and summons a ritual circle with an inner circle, an outer ring and a space in the middle.     • A black sludge will travel along the space stunning and dealing small typeless hits to players.     • Standing in the inner and outer rings will deal small typeless hits to the player.     • Stay off the red, avoid black sludge.     • Use / if you are in the black sludge to avoid getting stunned. ​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text:
⬥ Charge Pads

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The arena has 6 pads that you can stand on to charge.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When it is full charged, Zamorak will stop attacking for a while and your adrenaline bar will be refilled. After this, you will gain an Edict while Zamorak gains a Hex depending on the pad charged.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will become unable to charge pads when Zamorak says HEED MY CALL. To continue charging the next pad, you must enter Infernus and kill the mage present.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This happens after charging every pad.

Suggested Zamorak Edict Orders Use the RS Wiki to see what each pad does. Farming ⬥ <500%: 214653 ⬥ 500%: 241365 or 214365 ⬥ >900%: 241365 or 241356 Pushing ⬥ <900%: 241653 ⬥ >900% 1-2 Cycle 243615 or 243165 ⬥ >900% 0 Cycle 236514 or 235614     •0 cycle relies on killing zamorak with rod before small bombs.

​

Notes: Once Chaos Traps have been activated, and before stepping on other pads. Additionally, once the bar for charging a rune is full, move at least 3 squares away from the middle of the rune. If Coven is not your last rune, be prepared to kill a Healer and Protector.

​

docs.title: Enrage-Based Mechanics
docs.text:
Zamorak's damage and HP scales with enrage, and additional mechanics are introduced at specific enrage thresholds:

​

⬥ 100% Phase 7 is introduced

⬥ 500% During Infernal Tomb, all players must be on their rune at the same time to exit Infernus

⬥ 500% During Channelers, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 50% adrenaline and the first ability is Asphyxiate

⬥ 750% During Infernal Tomb, demons will move faster towards the portal

⬥ 900% During Channelers, grey HP healing ramp-up no longer resets between phases

⬥ 1000% During Channelers, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 100% adrenaline and their first ability is Omnipower

⬥ 1000% On phase 7, red bar charge is no longer reset between cycle(s)

⬥ 1000% On phase 7, Zamorak's life points cap at 250,000 per player

⬥ 1470% The life points of chaos demons cap at 70,000 while on Infernus

⬥ 1500% During the Adrenaline Cage attack, the targeted player will have their Devotion deactivated

⬥ 1600% Zamorak's stagger after killing a rune on Phase 7 reduced from 10 to 5 ticks

⬥ 1740% For phases 1-6, Zamorak's starting life points cap at 1,600,000 per player

⬥ 3500% On phase 7, the life points the runes revive with are capped at 60,000

​

docs.title: Example Kills
docs.text:
Example Kills Suggested Video Walkthrough Ranged ⬥ 100% Solo ⬥ 100% Solo (No Grico) ⬥ 500% Solo Melee ⬥ 110% Solo ⬥ 260% Solo Magic ⬥ 100% Solo ⬥ 130% Trio ⬥ 210% Solo ⬥ 440% Trio ⬥ 500% Solo ⬥ 1000% Solo

​

docs.title: Voice guidance throughout the kill
docs.text:
This tool reads your screen, and based on certain lines of dialogue in your chatbox, will trigger and play voice lines during the kill to let you know about upcoming mechanics and what to do for them.

​

Disclaimer: Alt1 is a third party tool, and while generally safe to use, is still recommended to be installed and used at your own risk.

Alt1 Zamorak Helper Check out Igor's Presets and follow the download instructions there for Alt1 presets for this boss and more!

​

docs.title: Vorago Duo Basic Guide - Ceilings Collapse (CC)
Introduction
docs.text:
​

This basic guide is designed to streamline players who are starting Vorago duos, and contains some information for Trio, such as the TL5 responsibilities. The strategies in this guide are safe and easy relative to Vorago. Note though, that Vorago is not an easy boss in general, and will likely take multiple attempts before you get a kill.

​

Each weekly rotation can be found as its own thread in the channel. The channel itself contains information related to the current weekly rotation.

​

docs.title: Preset and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestion & Breakdown ⬥ Necromancy ⬥ Magic ⬥ Ranged

docs.title: Additional Preset Information
docs.text:
⬥ With the use of the preset places onto an armour piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: That is greater bone shield, and turtling 3, not their more common counterparts.

⬥ Melee is significantly more challenging than the other combat styles, and is thus omitted.

⬥ The last relic slot does not have a clear "best." Use what you find is most comfortable.

docs.title: Misc Important Vorago Facts
docs.text:
⬥ BT refers to Bomb Tank, not Base Tank. Stands furthest away from Vorago to take bombs.

⬥ Base refers to Base tank, stands in melee distance of Vorago and holds aggression during most of the fight.

⬥ TL5 refers to the Top Lure 5.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is a trio+ role.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They perform the climb in Phase 1, and take the 5th bleed when applicable during Phase 2 and Phase 4.

⬥ Commonly used abilities/spells unique to Vorago: , , ,

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To equip the item in your inventory and then cade.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ As long as the isn't on a weapon/shield, you can switch back immediately.

docs.title: Face/Phase 0
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago deals 70% of your maximum life points upon entry into Phase 1.

⬥ Challenge takes 12s. A bar charges above Vorago's head to indicate when the fight will start.

⬥ Optionally to save on hp, right before the bar fills up, click your

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation

⬥ Three types of auto attack at random: Melee swipe, magic Blue Bomb, or both at the same time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto attack blue bombs home in on the furthest player from Vorago, deal AoE magic damage, and always hit.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee swipes deal AoE melee damage around Vorago and around the Base Tank. They can splash.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not melee swipe if the player with aggro is not in melee distance.

⬥ Red Bomb deals 2000 damage, comes with a non-homing Blue Bomb, clears defensives and puts them on cooldown

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thrown at the furthest player similar to Blue Bombs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For each player that is close to the bomb tank when the red bomb hits, an additional 1k damage occurs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move at least 4 tiles away from where you were stood to avoid the non-homing blue.

⬥ The phase can only end when someone has successfully jumped on Vorago to release the piece of the Maul of Omens.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Vorago's hp goes under about 13k before this, his HP will "reset" somewhere between 80-100k

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Prioritise tagging Vorago ASAP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Trio, as you tag.

⬥ Bring Vorago to the east of the red line in the image below. Once he is there use your main damaging abilities / /

⬥ Expect a few blue bombs. Prayer flick and use defensives as necessary. provides a big heal.

⬥ Once the BT has voked, stand directly south of the middle of Vorago and voke back at around 50k HP left.

docs.title: Top Lure (The Bomb Tank in duo)
docs.text:
⬥ Climb speed is paramount to survival

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Less damage is taken by you and your base on faster climbs.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use surge and dive as frequently as possible.

⬥ Vorago from two north and two west of the jump spot and do not move until Vorago has finished moving.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There is no leniency on what tile to stand on for this mechanic. If you mess up, the base must revoke vorago to the east and you must try again.

⬥ ‎ ‎Once Vorago stops moving, do a basic DPS rotation

⬥ ‎ ‎You must have at least one inventory space free for the Maul of Omens piece to be able to jump.

⬥ ‎ ‎Jump at <50k HP. Make sure to be high/full HP.

⬥ Food cannot be eaten during climb animations, but bombs can continue to land and stack damage upon animation finish. Make sure to maintain high HP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not risk death trying to save food. It is expected to use some this phase.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 2 is largely time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• One gravity orb spawns every reflect. Two are needed to progress. Missing orbs will result in additional cycles.

⬥ Use defensives to avoid food usage.

⬥ More advanced Vorago guides will minimise Vorago's movement on this phase, but while learning the focus should be on surviving and dealing with mechanics properly.

⬥ Vorago's Bleeds break defensives (i.e. take them off. So if you have resonance / cade up, it will remove them + you will receive damage.)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Appears as on debuff bar

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First bleed of the phase has no animation; it occurs during Vorago's spawning animation.

⬥ Reflect (Link)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• DO NOT ATTACK ON REFLECT

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago is immune to damage during this time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage dealt to Vorago instead goes to someone on the team

⬥ Spam click Vorago during Bring Him Down (BHD), then deal damage to free the maul piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• BHD damage threshold is a collective 50k.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use high damaging thresholds, but refrain from using / / as you will want them for next phase.

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clear the first two bleeds with and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use between the first and second bleeds to ensure aggro for the second bleed

⬥ You will tank the blue bomb that comes with the third bleed. is recommended.

⬥ Vorago after the fifth bleed.

⬥ It is recommended to + the BT on red bomb release.

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the second bleed.

⬥ the third, the fourth, and stand still for the fifth. The Base Tank will and lure the boss away to clear the fifth bleed.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will likely take at least one hit of bleed damage on the 5th bleed while learning.

⬥ Use any number of defensives against the Blue Bombs.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

⬥ Tag red gravity orbs when they spawn.

​

docs.title: Phase 3
docs.text: Weekly Special - Ceiling Collapse  Mechanic ⬥ Vorago drops a rock randomly on 1/9th of the arena. ⬥ Deals 8k damage divided by the number of players hit by the rock (e.g. 2 players are hit for 4k each). ⬥ Vorago jumps randomly to a different 1/9th of the arena.     • Vorago cannot jump on existing rocks. General Notes ⬥ Turn shadows and lighting detail up. Shadows should be at least MEDIUM. If you do not, you may not be able to see where the ceiling is falling. ⬥ Middle rocks can heavily hinder DPS in Phase 3. Clear middle rocks with .

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Often free-for-all BT. Distance from Vorago cannot be guaranteed due to Vorago's random jump positions. as needed.

⬥ Vorago can jump near the person with aggro. If this happens, he has a chance to melee swipe you. Aim to deflect melee

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Either player can volunteer to so that the other player doesn't have to deal with this. Otherwise free-for-all.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Both Players)
docs.text:
⬥ after the reflect or / after second jump.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This ensures players don't lose their ultimates due to a bad jump position

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not / on top of each other, so that only one of you has to tank blue bombs.

⬥ If taking a lot of damage, consider using and

⬥ Rocks that remain at the end of Phase 3 carry over into Phase 4.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If high HP at the end of Phase 3, players should clear rocks to clear the arena for Phase 4

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: if the rock is in the centre of the arena, it will be auto-cleared by Vorago once he spawns into the next phase

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 4 is time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Waterfalls are required to progress the phase. Lower Vorago's HP to under 30k before the last Waterfall.

⬥ Waterfall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Spawns in one of the four corners. Run behind it quickly, or take up to 10k damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Some tiles look safe but are not. If unsure, run all the way into the corner.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clears active defensives and puts them on cooldown.

⬥ Leftover rocks from Phase 3 carry over into Phase 4, landing in the same positions

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal 4k damage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These rocks may block Waterfalls. Clear them ASAP.

⬥ Use defensives to avoid food usage.

⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Massive time save if done both times

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• See role sections below for each player's responsibilities

⬥ If clone skip is not done, a clone will appear on the player who does not have aggro of Vorago.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Several blue bombs follow before the weekly special occurs (skipping this is the main time save).

⬥ Ceilings Collapse mechanic is the same as Phase Three

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Tank walks Vorago to the wall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Turn run off, spam click Vorago + surge out of the Waterfall, , walk under Vorago, click near the wall in the direction that Vorago walks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The BT may be out of bomb range, which means any potential bombs go to the Base Tank instead.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Eat to high HP in the Waterfall, prayer flick for Blue Bombs, and use / as needed.

⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into the Ceiling Collapse special.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rocks can fall underneath Vorago, on top of the Base. Make sure to turn run on after the clone skip to be able to avoid the rock if this happens.

⬥ Clear bleeds as you would do in phase 2.

​

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ If Clone Skip fails, BT should use against the Blue Bombs.

⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into the Ceiling Collapse special.

⬥ + the Base when Vorago begins the CC animation.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Both players should work to clear rocks.

⬥ cooldown is relevant

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not use the turtling switch for cades this phase.

⬥ Clear bleeds as you would do in phase 2.

⬥ Pick up the third piece after the last Waterfall, and click on any piece to assemble the Maul of Omens.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Ceilings Collapse week shares the same Phase 5 as Teamsplit

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Teamsplit damage does not cause him to push west at all.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Teamsplit cancels all active defensives.

⬥ Base Tank hugs south wall, while BT hugs north wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

⬥ If the phase lasts longer than one Teamsplit, the Base Tank and BT swap roles after every set of Vorago's Bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The player who is stood furthest out should build adrenaline to use for the first Blue after the teamsplit explodes.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Base Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use / / in melee distance shortly after the Teamsplit spawns

⬥ After the 2nd/4th/6th/etc TeamSplit you switch to the BT role. Use to tank the blue bombs.

⬥ After , build to 100% and / / during Reflect.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Bomb Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use a threshold → basics to 100% → when the first Blue Bomb lands.

⬥ Build to 100% and / / in melee distance ASAP (and do damage after reflect ends/ bleeds begin).

⬥ You will be the BT role after the 1st/3rd/5th/etc TeamSplit

docs.title: Phase End Notes
docs.text:
⬥ Lengthy phases can get hectic. Focus on proper and / / timings.

​

docs.title: Phase 3
docs.text: Weekly Special - Green Bomb  Mechanic ⬥ Vorago launches a green bomb that lands in a random 1/9th of the arena     • Covers this area in mist, then bounces and targets a player.     • Mist drains 10 adren for every time it deals damage, and run energy. Do not stand in the mist. ⬥ GB deals 10k damage to the targeted player if it is not passed. Do not pass the GB. Tank the damage.     • Passing occurs when the targeted player is within 2 tiles of another player. ⬥ Use  to mitigate some of the damage. General Notes ⬥ In Phase 3 and 5, Vorago goes into reflect after either 5 auto attacks, or the Green Bomb is tanked (whichever comes first).     • This is usually when the Green Bomb is tanked.

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Green Bomb

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If multiple Green Bombs target the same player, their partner can + and ensure they have the hp to survive.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ e.g. If the Green Bomb targets the BT twice, BT should the first, and the Base may + for the second Green Bomb landing.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If more than 2 Green Bombs are tanked, there is a high chance of death.

​

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Both Players)
docs.text:
⬥ Drop / + in one of the four corners melee distance, before Vorago spawns

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ensures one mist cannot cover the entire ultimate

⬥ If necro, use at start of the phase so it doesn't hit on reflect

⬥ + during reflect

​

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Voke at the start of the phase and stand melee distance to reduce damage taken by the BT. Watch out for middle mist.

​

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Avoid standing too close to Vorago. This is a common mistake from repositioning after the mist appears.

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Tank walks Vorago to the wall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Turn run off, spam click Vorago + surge out of the Waterfall, , walk under Vorago, click near the wall in the direction that Vorago walks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The BT may be out of bomb range, which means any potential bombs go to the Base Tank instead.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Eat to high HP in the Waterfall, prayer flick for Blue Bombs, and use / as needed.

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ If Clone Skip fails, BT should use against the Blue Bombs.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

​

⬥ Green Bomb:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On P5, reflect occurs after either 5 auto attacks or the Green Bomb is tanked. In reality, this means that reflect occurs when the Green Bomb is tanked.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Tanking the 10k hit from a Green Bomb causes 1 tile of pushback

​

⬥ Base Tank hugs the South wall, while Bomb Tank hugs the North wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

​

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to ‎ ‎the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

​

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Both Players)
docs.text:
⬥ Use / / at the start.

⬥ The person without the GB should +

⬥ The person with the GB can keep using thresholds

⬥ Both players build to 100% adrenaline and / / + during Reflect.

⬥ If the phase does not end before the second GB lands, there is a high chance of death. Avoid this at all costs.

​

docs.title: Vorago Duo Basic - The End (Purple Bomb/PB)
Introduction
docs.text:
​

This basic guide is designed to streamline players who are starting Vorago duos, and contains some information for Trio, such as the TL5 responsibilities. The strategies in this guide are safe and easy relative to Vorago. With good execution, players following this guide can reach up to 5 kills per hour.

​

Each weekly rotation can be found as its own thread in the channel. The channel itself contains information related to the current weekly rotation.

​

docs.title: Preset and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestion & Breakdown ⬥ Necromancy ⬥ Magic ⬥ Ranged

docs.title: Additional Preset Information
docs.text:
⬥ With the use of the preset places onto an armour piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: That is greater bone shield, and turtling 3, not their more common counterparts.

⬥ Melee is significantly more challenging than the other combat styles, and is thus omitted.

⬥ The last relic slot does not have a clear "best." Use what you find is most comfortable.

docs.title: Misc Important Vorago Facts
docs.text:
⬥ BT refers to Bomb Tank, not Base Tank. Stands furthest away from Vorago to take bombs.

⬥ Base refers to Base tank, stands in melee distance of Vorago and holds aggression during most of the fight.

⬥ TL5 refers to the Top Lure 5.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is a trio+ role.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They perform the climb in Phase 1, and take the 5th bleed when applicable during Phase 2 and Phase 4.

⬥ Commonly used abilities/spells unique to Vorago: , , ,

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To equip the item in your inventory and then cade.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ As long as the isn't on a weapon/shield, you can switch back immediately.

docs.title: Face/Phase 0
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago deals 70% of your maximum life points upon entry into Phase 1.

⬥ Challenge takes 12s. A bar charges above Vorago's head to indicate when the fight will start.

⬥ Optionally to save on hp, right before the bar fills up, click your

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation

⬥ Three types of auto attack at random: Melee swipe, magic Blue Bomb, or both at the same time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto attack blue bombs home in on the furthest player from Vorago, deal AoE magic damage, and always hit.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee swipes deal AoE melee damage around Vorago and around the Base Tank. They can splash.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not melee swipe if the player with aggro is not in melee distance.

⬥ Red Bomb deals 2000 damage, comes with a non-homing Blue Bomb, clears defensives and puts them on cooldown

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thrown at the furthest player similar to Blue Bombs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For each player that is close to the bomb tank when the red bomb hits, an additional 1k damage occurs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move at least 4 tiles away from where you were stood to avoid the non-homing blue.

⬥ The phase can only end when someone has successfully jumped on Vorago to release the piece of the Maul of Omens.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Vorago's hp goes under about 13k before this, his HP will "reset" somewhere between 80-100k

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Prioritise tagging Vorago ASAP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Trio, as you tag.

⬥ Bring Vorago to the east of the red line in the image below. Once he is there use your main damaging abilities / /

⬥ Expect a few blue bombs. Prayer flick and use defensives as necessary. provides a big heal.

⬥ Once the BT has voked, stand directly south of the middle of Vorago and voke back at around 50k HP left.

docs.title: Top Lure (The Bomb Tank in duo)
docs.text:
⬥ Climb speed is paramount to survival

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Less damage is taken by you and your base on faster climbs.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use surge and dive as frequently as possible.

⬥ Vorago from two north and two west of the jump spot and do not move until Vorago has finished moving.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There is no leniency on what tile to stand on for this mechanic. If you mess up, the base must revoke vorago to the east and you must try again.

⬥ ‎ ‎Once Vorago stops moving, do a basic DPS rotation

⬥ ‎ ‎You must have at least one inventory space free for the Maul of Omens piece to be able to jump.

⬥ ‎ ‎Jump at <50k HP. Make sure to be high/full HP.

⬥ Food cannot be eaten during climb animations, but bombs can continue to land and stack damage upon animation finish. Make sure to maintain high HP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not risk death trying to save food. It is expected to use some this phase.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 2 is largely time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• One gravity orb spawns every reflect. Two are needed to progress. Missing orbs will result in additional cycles.

⬥ Use defensives to avoid food usage.

⬥ More advanced Vorago guides will minimise Vorago's movement on this phase, but while learning the focus should be on surviving and dealing with mechanics properly.

⬥ Vorago's Bleeds break defensives (i.e. take them off. So if you have resonance / cade up, it will remove them + you will receive damage.)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Appears as on debuff bar

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First bleed of the phase has no animation; it occurs during Vorago's spawning animation.

⬥ Reflect (Link)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• DO NOT ATTACK ON REFLECT

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago is immune to damage during this time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage dealt to Vorago instead goes to someone on the team

⬥ Spam click Vorago during Bring Him Down (BHD), then deal damage to free the maul piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• BHD damage threshold is a collective 50k.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use high damaging thresholds, but refrain from using / / as you will want them for next phase.

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clear the first two bleeds with and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use between the first and second bleeds to ensure aggro for the second bleed

⬥ You will tank the blue bomb that comes with the third bleed. is recommended.

⬥ Vorago after the fifth bleed.

⬥ It is recommended to + the BT on red bomb release.

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the second bleed.

⬥ the third, the fourth, and stand still for the fifth. The Base Tank will and lure the boss away to clear the fifth bleed.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will likely take at least one hit of bleed damage on the 5th bleed while learning.

⬥ Use any number of defensives against the Blue Bombs.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

⬥ Tag red gravity orbs when they spawn.

​

docs.title: Phase 3
docs.text: Weekly Special - The End  Mechanic ⬥ Vorago sections off a quarter of the arena with his arms.     • Stand in the arms or take rapidly increasing typeless damage. ⬥ Vorago rotates his arms anticlockwise. Follow the arms or be smacked for 2.5k. ⬥ Quadrants 2-4 contain bombs, with heavy damage reduction depending on the bomb:     • In the Blue Bomb quadrant, Vorago takes 1/2 damage.     • In the Red Bomb Quadrant, Vorago takes 1/3 damage.     • In the Purple Bomb Quadrant, Vorago takes 1/4 damage. ⬥ After the last quadrant, Vorago stands up and releases all untagged bombs, in addition to Vorago's normal auto attacks.

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ The End

⬥ One person tags all Blue Bombs, while the other person uses +

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tagging Blue Bombs resets + puts it on cooldown. This is a two person job.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bomb tag and + can be done by either player. Sort this out in advance.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using slightly early is advised. Intercept will sometimes fail while your character is moving and can cause you to pk your partner.

⬥ when bombs are released after Vorago stands up.

⬥ Stop attacking after the purple bomb explodes (for the reflect mechanic).

​

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ When Vorago stands up, + stand melee distance to reduce damage taken by the BT.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note that this is done if you + for the blue bombs during the mechanic.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If you do not, the Base will take blue bombs + melee swipes and it can be painful.

​

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ When Vorago stands up, make sure to be far away from Vorago.

​

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Both Players)
docs.text:
⬥ If using necro, while going to first quadrant and before he puts his arms down

⬥ Thresh and apply affinity debuffs in the first quadrant (no damage reduction)

⬥ Use basics to prepare for bomb tag during the second or third quadrant.

⬥ / + at the end of the third quadrant

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move back into ultimate after the fourth quadrant and prepare to do damage when Vorago stands.

⬥ Ditch ultimates for second set of arms if necessary. Try to finish the phase with thresholds.

⬥ If a second stand is expected, players should switch roles for the tag + cepting of blue bombs if needed.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 4 is time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Waterfalls are required to progress the phase. Lower Vorago's HP to under 30k before the last Waterfall.

⬥ Waterfall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Spawns in one of the four corners. Run behind it quickly, or take up to 10k damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Some tiles look safe but are not. If unsure, run all the way into the corner.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clears active defensives and puts them on cooldown.

⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Massive time save if done both times

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• See role sections below for each player's responsibilities

⬥ The End

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Same mechanic as Phase 3, except:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ After Vorago stands up, there are 3 auto attacks then his Red Bomb.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ After the Red bomb, Vorago will use 4 auto attacks before reflect.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ + strategies are used to handle the bombs instead of Vitality potion

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Do not use as it extends the cooldown for too long to be used twice on this phase

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Tank walks Vorago to the wall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Turn run off, spam click Vorago + surge out of the Waterfall, , walk under Vorago, click near the wall in the direction that Vorago walks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The BT may be out of bomb range, which means any potential bombs go to the Base Tank instead.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Eat to high HP in the Waterfall, prayer flick for Blue Bombs, and use / as needed.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ ⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into The End (Purple Bomb) special.

⬥ Build adrenaline throughout the arms animation

⬥ Tag red bombs in their quadrant. The Bomb Tank should use + on you for this.

⬥ Red bombs drain adrenaline, ensure that you have 100% by Vorago's stand.

⬥ When Vorago stands up, use + on the Bomb Tank. Re-cept when cade timer has 10s left.

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ If Clone Skip fails, BT should use against the Blue Bombs.

⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into The End (Purple Bomb) special.

⬥ In the quadrant with Red Bombs, use + on the Base Tank while they tag Red Bombs.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

docs.text:

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

⬥ PB

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago turns all players into explosive Vitali, with a timer above their head.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When timer hits 0, a purple bomb explodes on the player. This is AoE, so avoid standing near your partner.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago will do 5 auto attacks before reflect.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Standing on opposite walls largely allows you to ignore this special.

⬥ Base Tank hugs the South wall, while Bomb Tank hugs the North wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

​

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to ‎ ‎the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Base Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use / / in melee distance

⬥ If you do not get the kill before the bleeds end, you will swap into the bomb tanking role

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use to tank the blue bombs during the purple bomb special.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Bomb Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use a threshold → basics to 100% → when the first Blue Bomb lands.

⬥ If you do not get the kill before the bleeds end, you will swap into the base tanking role

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build to 100% and / / in melee distance ASAP

​

docs.text: Weekly Special - Scopulus  Mechanic ⬥ Vorago spawns two Scopuli (150k hp each) in the arena, one spawns in the south-west, the other in the south-east. Vorago is invulnerable in this phase.  ⬥ The Base tank should aim to tank both scopulus      • Scopuli hit hard and fast with melee auto attacks. Base tank without  will die very quickly ⬥ Vorago throws constant Blue Bombs to the furthest person out (the BT) until the last scopulus is killed.

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
Suggested Rotations (Both Players)

⬥ / / before Scopuli spawn.

⬥ Prioritise AoE abilities to speed up the phase.

⬥ Long phases can get very painful due to high Scopuli damage and constant blue bombs.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use to survive, or if needed + each other.

​

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Start west of the western Scopulus

⬥ HOLD SCOPULI AGGRO AT ALL COSTS

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tag both Scopuli before the Bomb Tank.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Scopuli reaggro onto the BT, use to draw them back.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vuln bombs can be thrown throughout the phase to keep Scopuli aggression on the base.

​

docs.text:

⬥ DO NOT ATTACK SCOPULI UNTIL BASE TANK TAGS THEM BOTH

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

⬥ PB

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago turns all players into explosive Vitali, with a timer above their head.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When timer hits 0, a purple bomb explodes on the player. This is AoE, so avoid standing near your partner.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago will do 5 auto attacks before reflect.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Standing on opposite walls largely allows you to ignore this special.

⬥ Base Tank hugs the South wall, while Bomb Tank hugs the North wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

​

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to ‎ ‎the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Base Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use / / in melee distance

⬥ If you do not get the kill before the bleeds end, you will swap into the bomb tanking role

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use to tank the blue bombs during the purple bomb special.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Bomb Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use a threshold → basics to 100% → when the first Blue Bomb lands.

⬥ If you do not get the kill before the bleeds end, you will swap into the base tanking role

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build to 100% and / / in melee distance ASAP

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
​

This basic guide is designed to streamline players who are starting Vorago duos, and contains some information for Trio, such as the TL5 responsibilities. The strategies in this guide are safe and easy relative to Vorago. Note though, that Vorago is not an easy boss in general, and will likely take multiple attempts before you get a kill.

​

Each weekly rotation can be found as its own thread in the channel. The channel itself contains information related to the current weekly rotation.

docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation

⬥ Three types of auto attack at random: Melee swipe, magic Blue Bomb, or both at the same time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto attack blue bombs home in on the furthest player from Vorago, deal AoE magic damage, and always hit.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee swipes deal AoE melee damage around Vorago and around the Base Tank. They can splash.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not melee swipe if the player with aggro is not in melee distance.

⬥ Red Bomb deals 2000 damage, comes with a non-homing Blue Bomb, clears defensives and puts them on cooldown

⬥ ‎ ‎Once Vorago stops moving, do a basic DPS rotation

⬥ ‎ ‎You must have at least one inventory space free for the Maul of Omens piece to be able to jump.

⬥ ‎ ‎Jump at <50k HP. Make sure to be high/full HP.

⬥ Food cannot be eaten during climb animations, but bombs can continue to land and stack damage upon animation finish. Make sure to maintain high HP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not risk death trying to save food. It is expected to use some this phase.

⬥ Ceilings Collapse week shares the same Phase 5 as Teamsplit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

This basic guide is designed to streamline players who are starting Vorago duos, and contains some information for Trio, such as the TL5 responsibilities. ⬥ If Vitali are still alive during reflect, be careful of using AoEs that may hit Vorago, or randomly losing Vitali as your target and hitting Vorago

​

⬥ If using necro is really good at clearing vits. Prioritise high hitting abilities during it such as or

docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Tank walks Vorago to the wall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Turn run off, spam click Vorago + surge out of the Waterfall, , walk under Vorago, click near the wall in the direction that Vorago walks

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

​

⬥ Vitalis orb can randomly spawn 2–4 Vitali (instead of 5 as it does on Phase 3/4).

⬥ Number of Vitali spawned is reduced for each player standing on it when it explodes.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vitalis orb always causes pushback (even under ) if at least one person is blocking spawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vitalis melee attacks also cause pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players should prioritise blocking vitalis orb and quickly killing spawned Vitali.

​

⬥ Base Tank hugs south wall, while BT hugs north wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

​

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to ‎ ‎the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

​

⬥ If the phase lasts longer than one Vitalis orb, the Base Tank and BT swap roles after every set of Vorago's Bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The player who is stood furthest out should build adrenaline to use for the Vitalis orb.

​

docs.text:

docs.title: Vorago Duo Basic Guide - Ceilings Collapse (CC)
Introduction
docs.text:
​

This basic guide is designed to streamline players who are starting Vorago duos, and contains some information for Trio, such as the TL5 responsibilities. The strategies in this guide are safe and easy relative to Vorago. Note though, that Vorago is not an easy boss in general, and will likely take multiple attempts before you get a kill.

​

Each weekly rotation can be found as its own thread in the channel. The channel itself contains information related to the current weekly rotation.

​

docs.title: Preset and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestion & Breakdown ⬥ Necromancy ⬥ Magic ⬥ Ranged

docs.title: Additional Preset Information
docs.text:
⬥ With the use of the preset places onto an armour piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: That is greater bone shield, and turtling 3, not their more common counterparts.

⬥ Melee is significantly more challenging than the other combat styles, and is thus omitted.

⬥ The last relic slot does not have a clear "best." Use what you find is most comfortable.

docs.title: Misc Important Vorago Facts
docs.text:
⬥ BT refers to Bomb Tank, not Base Tank. Stands furthest away from Vorago to take bombs.

⬥ Base refers to Base tank, stands in melee distance of Vorago and holds aggression during most of the fight.

⬥ TL5 refers to the Top Lure 5.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is a trio+ role.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They perform the climb in Phase 1, and take the 5th bleed when applicable during Phase 2 and Phase 4.

⬥ Commonly used abilities/spells unique to Vorago: , , ,

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To equip the item in your inventory and then cade.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ As long as the isn't on a weapon/shield, you can switch back immediately.

docs.title: Face/Phase 0
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago deals 70% of your maximum life points upon entry into Phase 1.

⬥ Challenge takes 12s. A bar charges above Vorago's head to indicate when the fight will start.

⬥ Optionally to save on hp, right before the bar fills up, click your

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation

⬥ Three types of auto attack at random: Melee swipe, magic Blue Bomb, or both at the same time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto attack blue bombs home in on the furthest player from Vorago, deal AoE magic damage, and always hit.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee swipes deal AoE melee damage around Vorago and around the Base Tank. They can splash.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not melee swipe if the player with aggro is not in melee distance.

⬥ Red Bomb deals 2000 damage, comes with a non-homing Blue Bomb, clears defensives and puts them on cooldown

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thrown at the furthest player similar to Blue Bombs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For each player that is close to the bomb tank when the red bomb hits, an additional 1k damage occurs

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move at least 4 tiles away from where you were stood to avoid the non-homing blue.

⬥ The phase can only end when someone has successfully jumped on Vorago to release the piece of the Maul of Omens.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Vorago's hp goes under about 13k before this, his HP will "reset" somewhere between 80-100k

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Prioritise tagging Vorago ASAP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Trio, as you tag.

⬥ Bring Vorago to the east of the red line in the image below. Once he is there use your main damaging abilities / /

⬥ Expect a few blue bombs. Prayer flick and use defensives as necessary. provides a big heal.

⬥ Once the BT has voked, stand directly south of the middle of Vorago and voke back at around 50k HP left.

docs.title: Top Lure (The Bomb Tank in duo)
docs.text:
⬥ Climb speed is paramount to survival

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Less damage is taken by you and your base on faster climbs.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use surge and dive as frequently as possible.

⬥ Vorago from two north and two west of the jump spot and do not move until Vorago has finished moving.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There is no leniency on what tile to stand on for this mechanic. If you mess up, the base must revoke vorago to the east and you must try again.

⬥ ‎ ‎Once Vorago stops moving, do a basic DPS rotation

⬥ ‎ ‎You must have at least one inventory space free for the Maul of Omens piece to be able to jump.

⬥ ‎ ‎Jump at <50k HP. Make sure to be high/full HP.

⬥ Food cannot be eaten during climb animations, but bombs can continue to land and stack damage upon animation finish. Make sure to maintain high HP.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not risk death trying to save food. It is expected to use some this phase.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 2 is largely time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• One gravity orb spawns every reflect. Two are needed to progress. Missing orbs will result in additional cycles.

⬥ Use defensives to avoid food usage.

⬥ More advanced Vorago guides will minimise Vorago's movement on this phase, but while learning the focus should be on surviving and dealing with mechanics properly.

⬥ Vorago's Bleeds break defensives (i.e. take them off. So if you have resonance / cade up, it will remove them + you will receive damage.)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Appears as on debuff bar

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First bleed of the phase has no animation; it occurs during Vorago's spawning animation.

⬥ Reflect (Link)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• DO NOT ATTACK ON REFLECT

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago is immune to damage during this time

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage dealt to Vorago instead goes to someone on the team

⬥ Spam click Vorago during Bring Him Down (BHD), then deal damage to free the maul piece.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• BHD damage threshold is a collective 50k.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use high damaging thresholds, but refrain from using / / as you will want them for next phase.

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clear the first two bleeds with and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use between the first and second bleeds to ensure aggro for the second bleed

⬥ You will tank the blue bomb that comes with the third bleed. is recommended.

⬥ Vorago after the fifth bleed.

⬥ It is recommended to + the BT on red bomb release.

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the second bleed.

⬥ the third, the fourth, and stand still for the fifth. The Base Tank will and lure the boss away to clear the fifth bleed.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will likely take at least one hit of bleed damage on the 5th bleed while learning.

⬥ Use any number of defensives against the Blue Bombs.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

⬥ Tag red gravity orbs when they spawn.

​

docs.title: Phase 3
docs.text: Weekly Special - Ceiling Collapse  Mechanic ⬥ Vorago drops a rock randomly on 1/9th of the arena. ⬥ Deals 8k damage divided by the number of players hit by the rock (e.g. 2 players are hit for 4k each). ⬥ Vorago jumps randomly to a different 1/9th of the arena.     • Vorago cannot jump on existing rocks. General Notes ⬥ Turn shadows and lighting detail up. Shadows should be at least MEDIUM. If you do not, you may not be able to see where the ceiling is falling. ⬥ Middle rocks can heavily hinder DPS in Phase 3. Clear middle rocks with .

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Often free-for-all BT. Distance from Vorago cannot be guaranteed due to Vorago's random jump positions. as needed.

⬥ Vorago can jump near the person with aggro. If this happens, he has a chance to melee swipe you. Aim to deflect melee

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Either player can volunteer to so that the other player doesn't have to deal with this. Otherwise free-for-all.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Both Players)
docs.text:
⬥ after the reflect or / after second jump.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This ensures players don't lose their ultimates due to a bad jump position

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not / on top of each other, so that only one of you has to tank blue bombs.

⬥ If taking a lot of damage, consider using and

⬥ Rocks that remain at the end of Phase 3 carry over into Phase 4.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If high HP at the end of Phase 3, players should clear rocks to clear the arena for Phase 4

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: if the rock is in the centre of the arena, it will be auto-cleared by Vorago once he spawns into the next phase

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Phase 4 is time gated. Focus on mechanics.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Waterfalls are required to progress the phase. Lower Vorago's HP to under 30k before the last Waterfall.

⬥ Waterfall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Spawns in one of the four corners. Run behind it quickly, or take up to 10k damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Some tiles look safe but are not. If unsure, run all the way into the corner.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clears active defensives and puts them on cooldown.

⬥ Leftover rocks from Phase 3 carry over into Phase 4, landing in the same positions

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal 4k damage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These rocks may block Waterfalls. Clear them ASAP.

⬥ Use defensives to avoid food usage.

⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Massive time save if done both times

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• See role sections below for each player's responsibilities

⬥ If clone skip is not done, a clone will appear on the player who does not have aggro of Vorago.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Several blue bombs follow before the weekly special occurs (skipping this is the main time save).

⬥ Ceilings Collapse mechanic is the same as Phase Three

docs.title: Base Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Tank walks Vorago to the wall

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Turn run off, spam click Vorago + surge out of the Waterfall, , walk under Vorago, click near the wall in the direction that Vorago walks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The BT may be out of bomb range, which means any potential bombs go to the Base Tank instead.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Eat to high HP in the Waterfall, prayer flick for Blue Bombs, and use / as needed.

⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into the Ceiling Collapse special.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rocks can fall underneath Vorago, on top of the Base. Make sure to turn run on after the clone skip to be able to avoid the rock if this happens.

⬥ Clear bleeds as you would do in phase 2.

​

docs.title: Bomb Tank
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ If Clone Skip fails, BT should use against the Blue Bombs.

⬥ After the skip, Vorago goes straight into the Ceiling Collapse special.

⬥ + the Base when Vorago begins the CC animation.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Both players should work to clear rocks.

⬥ cooldown is relevant

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not use the turtling switch for cades this phase.

⬥ Clear bleeds as you would do in phase 2.

⬥ Pick up the third piece after the last Waterfall, and click on any piece to assemble the Maul of Omens.

docs.title: TL5 (if trio+)
docs.text:
⬥ Clone skip

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Surge to the wall opposite of Vorago

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Move in when Vorago does the clone animation (fake melee swipe)

⬥ Use after the fourth bleed.

⬥ Use to clear the 5th bleed when it is applied.

⬥ Step back out of melee distance after the Base vokes Vorago.

​

docs.title: For Both Players
docs.text:
⬥ Vorago's attack rotation:

⬥ Ceilings Collapse week shares the same Phase 5 as Teamsplit

⬥ Reverse tug-of-war mechanic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 20k damage against Vorago pushes him east 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each tick of damage received from Vorago he pushes west 1 square

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Any damage mitigated from negates any pushback

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Vorago all the way to the east, move melee distance, and click the Maul of Omens

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Teamsplit damage does not cause him to push west at all.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Teamsplit cancels all active defensives.

⬥ Base Tank hugs south wall, while BT hugs north wall. Players should only move away from their respective walls to clear Vorago's bleeds.

⬥ Bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 bleeds with that are randomly assigned

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vorago does not throw blue bombs during bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taking damage from bleeds results in Vorago pushing further west. Prioritise clearing them over DPS.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleeds are cleared by distance from the tile the bleed was received, not distance from Vorago in this phase.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move melee distance + go to the center of the arena. That way you can properly to remove bleeds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The safest way to clear bleeds in case you get all 3 is to the first bleed and then run back melee distance, second bleed. the third bleed.

⬥ If the phase lasts longer than one Teamsplit, the Base Tank and BT swap roles after every set of Vorago's Bleeds.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The player who is stood furthest out should build adrenaline to use for the first Blue after the teamsplit explodes.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Base Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use / / in melee distance shortly after the Teamsplit spawns

⬥ After the 2nd/4th/6th/etc TeamSplit you switch to the BT role. Use to tank the blue bombs.

⬥ After , build to 100% and / / during Reflect.

docs.title: Suggested Rotations (Bomb Tank)
docs.text:
⬥ Use a threshold → basics to 100% → when the first Blue Bomb lands.

⬥ Build to 100% and / / in melee distance ASAP (and do damage after reflect ends/ bleeds begin).

⬥ You will be the BT role after the 1st/3rd/5th/etc TeamSplit

docs.title: Phase End Notes
docs.text:
⬥ Lengthy phases can get hectic. Focus on proper and / / timings.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
This guide will go over how to complete the Grandmaster Speed Killer Combat Achievement for Normal Mode Vorago.

​

docs.title: Vorago-Specific Tricks/Skips
docs.text:
This section will cover the different tricks and skips specific to the Vorago fight that are necessary in order to achieve the GM timer.

​

docs.title: TC Timing:
docs.text:
⬥ Every single phase Vorago can be targeted with Target Cycle earlier than he visibly shows up in the arena. Learning this timing is integral to speedkills so you do not lose ticks. This is especially important on P5, as if you do not attack and push Vorago on-tick, TeamSplit will immediately spawn which is too much time-loss for the GM timer. ⬥ The easiest way to learn this timing is by using the Alt1 Plug-In called 'Vorago Timer' found in #alt1. ⬥ Another common way to time it is to use an ability with a 10-second cooldown on the tick that you would normally crack-heal. The ability will come off cooldown on the exact tick you want to TC. , , and are the best options as they can be used off GCD, so they won't interrupt prebuilds. ⬥ One more way you can align your TC timing is using Vorago's jumping animations. If you use an ability right as you see Vorago land, and continuously use GCDs from that point on without losing ticks, you will be lined up perfectly going into P3 or P5 so that your will be on the correct tick. ⬥ Note that, if you follow the rotations below, you will not need to do anything special for P3 TC timing. Phasing Vorago on P2 with and then immediately targeting the dummy and using continuous GCDs without losing ticks will align you properly to on the correct tick.

​

docs.title: Solo Lure:
docs.text:
⬥ Solo Lure refers to the Base Tank luring Vorago to the exact correct spot for the jump, so that the Bomb Tank can instantly jump. ⬥ See here for a detailed video guide on how to Solo Lure.

​

docs.title: Accel-Pot Climb:
docs.text:
⬥ Accel-Pot Climb refers to using an in order to do the Top Lure climb in the most optimal way possible. For the purpose of GM, you want to be consistently clicking to jump on Vorago's back no later than the first tick of 0:30 seconds. ⬥ If you are struggling with losing ticks elsewhere, it may be worth it to learn how to get 0:28 climbs, as this is something you can practice very easily solo. ⬥ See here for an example of what a 0:28 climb looks like.

​

docs.title: Clone Skip:
docs.text:
⬥ Clone Skip refers to skipping the Phase 4 clones. This is done by having the Base Tank walk Vorago all the way to the side of an arena, while the Bomb Tank stays all the way on on the opposite wall, outside of Vorago's attack range. Since Vorago can only give clones to the Bomb Tank, but the Bomb Tank is out of range of Vorago's attacks, the special is skipped entirely. ⬥ There are several ways for the Base Tank to walk Vorago, but the easiest method is to turn your Run off and spam click the opposite side of Vorago in order to walk underneath him. You may have to adjust where you click depending on what direction Vorago starts walking. ⬥Ceiling Collapse rocks can block Vorago from walking to a particular side of the Arena, so make sure to remove all non-corner rocks prior to Clone Skip. ⬥ One thing to note is that Vorago will never walk north. This can be helpful to know as it means north ceiling rocks do not need to be destroyed, and can be useful to save to give the Base Tank more options later for Bleeds Skip.

​

docs.title: Bleeds Skip:
docs.text:
⬥ Bleeds Skip refers to skipping the Phase 4 bleeds. This is done by luring Vorago around a Ceiling Collapse rock in such a way that he gets stuck on the rock and cannot get within melee distance of you to apply bleeds. ⬥ Vorago will jump and drop a Ceiling Collapse, throw two auto attacks, then begin bleeds. As soon as he applies the first bleed is when you want to trap him on the rock so he cannot apply any subsequent bleeds. ⬥ Once Vorago is stuck, make sure nobody attacks him as it will break the skip. This includes familiars, so familiar attack mode should be set to 'Passive'. ⬥ For a better understanding of how the movement looks, check out the example videos below to see the skips in action.

​
