docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
​

Zamorak, Lord of Chaos is the fifth and final installment in the Elder God Wars. This guide will primarily focus on clearing the dungeon segment, for help defeating the boss visit #Zamorak Main Guide.

​

docs.title: General Notes for Senntisten Undercity + Zamorak
docs.text:
⬥ Lucky charms for the dungeon can be bought from Thoksdottir at Daemonheim

⬥ A LOT of mobs can be ignored throughout the dungeon, but note that Menders and Dark Wizards will heal mobs/drain your adrenaline

⬥ The only required minibosses are the Jailer on the second floor (who teleports to different floors after 50k damage dealt x Team Size) and Eterna being the second boss before Zamorak.

⬥ A Demon / Greater Demon slayer task will affect a great number of mobs present in the dungeon.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kuradal offers the best chance for this task.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
DISCLAIMER: Presets below have been made for both the dungeon and boss based on preliminary knowledge. This will change as more information becomes available. Upgrade as you see fit, the gear posted below is merely the minimum we suggest.

​

It is assumed that Zuk capes for your chosen style, Disruption Shield and passive Ring of Vigour are unlocked.

​

⬥ All gear used is based on Stage 1 of #upgrade-order, with the addition of the following:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ranged skillcape on Anachronia cape stand/Max Cape + Igneous Kal-Xil

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Strength skillcape on Anachronia cape stand/Max Cape (For effect while wearing )

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• City of Senntisten spells

​

Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic ⬥ Melee ⬥ Ranged

​

docs.title: Recommended Upgrades
docs.text:
These items should be part of your preset if you have them or can afford them, listed in order of cost-effectiveness.

​

⬥ Melee

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Masterwork Spear of Annihilation or off-hand Lunging 4 switch

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zaros Godsword

​

⬥ Ranged

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Dark Bow

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Caroming 4 switch

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ascendrii bolts (e)

​

⬥ Magic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Caroming 4 switch

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fractured Staff of Armadyl and Erethdor's grimoire

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Guthix Staff

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Armadyl Battlestaff

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Cryptbloom Equipment

​

docs.title: Mefis the Jailer
docs.text:
Mefis the Jailer is the first boss of the dungeon, this boss is a typical "mini-boss" styled encounter, dealing magic auto-attacks and low upfront damage to the player.

Mefis will teleport to different floors after (50k damage dealt X Team Size), (ex: see this link for locations) Damage Scaling • 1 Person: 50k Damage before the jailer teleports • 2 People: 100k Damage before the jailer teleports • 3 People: 150k Damage before the jailer teleports • 4 People: 200k Damage before the jailer teleports • 5 People: 250k Damage before the jailer teleports

​

docs.title: Unlocking Eterna's Door
docs.text:
To unlock Eterna's doorway you must find two crystal pylon locations see Dungeon Floor Overview Section for the respective locations

​

docs.title: Eterna
docs.text:
Eterna is the last boss of the dungeon, this boss has multiple high hitting mechanics and does alternating magic / ranged auto-attacks throughout the fight.

Phase 1 ⬥ Deal damage until Eterna phases     • Eterna will spawn a single Chaos Demon Savage after phasing, kill them to move into phase 2. Phase 2 ⬥ Eterna re-appears with full HP along with spawning spiked-circles on the ground, deal damage until phase HP again to move on.     • Circles can be dealt with by using defensives or ⬥ Magic bombs will also spawn from the red portal in the center dealing low magic damage. ⬥ Two Chaos Demon Savages will spawn kill them to proceed to phase 3. Phase 3 ⬥ Eterna re-appears with all mechanics listed previously, deal damage until she is dead to move on to the next room. ⬥ The red portal in the center fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head.     • When this bar depletes, a 5x5 area around the player will become engulfed in smoke, dealing more damage the longer you stand inside.

​

docs.title: Example Runs
docs.text:
Note: All of these runs are done on release and are to be taken as a quick reference for the time being. As time progresses, proper example kills with much better handling of mechanics will be posted. If you have an example kill you'd like to submit for posting feel free to submit it and label it as such in <#SOME CHANNEL>.

​

Run Videos Simple kills where mechanics may or may not be handled properly. Ranged ⬥ 0% by ⬥ 0% by Melee ⬥ 0% by ⬥ 0% by Magic ⬥ 0% by ⬥ 0% by ⬥ 110% by

docs.title: General Notes:
docs.text:
⬥ DoT effects freeze when exiting the infernus and continue with re-entry.

⬥ rarely but can splash ranged autos.

⬥ Due to variance rotations may phase into grey health sooner than anticipated.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This speeds up rotations allowing some abilities to be skipped at discretion.

​

docs.title: Hellhound Strategy
docs.text:
Many of melee's damage handicaps are lifted at making the fight fun and interesting to play out. Lifted hitcaps and massive adrenaline refund allows + and to deal their full damage. In addition, since is not poisonable, glove swapping is not necessary either. A hellhound is a much safer familiar choice than a ripper demon . Aim to have on average 5:55-6:05 kill times at 7-8kph.

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• at < 92 adrenaline.

⬥ Guide assumes players can handle all specs.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
​

Zamorak, Lord of Chaos is the fifth and final installment in the Elder God Wars dungeon. This guide will primarily focus on the final boss encounter. For help clearing the dungeon, refer to #Zamorakian Undercity. If you would like a more simple version of the guide for your first few kills, refer to #Zamorak Basic Guide.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic | High Enrage ⬥ Melee ⬥ Necromancy ⬥ Ranged ⬥ Magic Checklist and Unlocks ⬥ Zuk cape for your chosen style ⬥ Disruption Shield unlocked ⬥ Toolbelt Infernal Puzzle Box unlocked. ⬥ Passive Ring of Vigour unlocked ⬥ Darkness/Animate Dead active ⬥ Bonfire + thermal spa HP boosts are active

​

docs.title: Recommended Upgrades
docs.text:
These items should be part of your preset if available and will aid in being able to follow the rotations and strategies in our Zamorak guides

​

⬥ Melee

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Leng swords or highest available tier of melee weapon

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• EoF with Dragon claws or Ek-ZekKil

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vestments of havoc equipment

​

⬥ Ranged

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bow of the Last Guardian, Seren godbow, or Noxious longbow

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quiver with Ful/Wen arrows and Deathspore arrows

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• EoF with Zamorak bow, Seren godbow, Eldritch crossbow, and Dark bow

​

⬥ Magic

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fractured Staff of Armadyl and Erethdor's grimoire

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• with Zamorak staff , Armadyl battlestaff, and/or Iban's staff

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• City of Senntisten spells unlocked

​

⬥ Necromancy

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rasial weapons or highest available tier of necromancy weapons

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• EoF with Death guard

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First Necromancer equipment

​

Note: The quest Twilight of the Gods will grant 10% reduced damage taken against Zamorak

docs.title: Fight Overview
docs.text:
Zamorak has 6 phases that are progressed by depleting his health bar and charging the 6 edicts, or pads, located around the arena. During each phase he will cycle through 3 health bar colours, each with their own effects that dictate the progression of the fight:

⬥ Grey HP: The health bar Zamorak starts with and regains between each phase

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will have accelerated 4-tick attack speed and deal 50% more damage, but won't use special attacks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cannot be fully depleted through damage and will constantly regenerate itself at an increasing rate

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Healing is prevented on ticks that Zamorak takes damage, meaning DoT and multihit abilities can be used to stall the healing somewhat

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ At 900% enrage, regeneration increase will start carrying over between grey HP phases, meaning healing will keep scaling to become drastically higher in later phases

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Upon activating a pad, all remaining grey HP will be converted into red HP

⬥ Red HP: The health bar Zamorak gains upon the player activating a pad

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will have accelerated 4-tick attack speed and deal 50% more damage, and will do his next special attack every 10 auto attacks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The first mechanic in red HP will carry over attacks from the previous green HP phase, see the Special Attack Order section for more information

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Must be depleted by dealing damage and will be followed by green HP

⬥ Green HP: Zamorak's main health bar, and is split into 6 sections representing each phase

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will have 5-tick attack rate and deal normal damage, and will do his next special attack every 5 auto attacks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The first mechanic in green HP on each phase will happen after 1 auto attack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Upon depletion of each section, Zamorak will regain Grey HP and start the Channelers mechanic

​

Overall, the progression of the first 6 phases can be summarised as:

​

Grey HP > charge pad > deplete red HP > deplete green HP section > Channelers + grey HP > repeat

​

⬥ Zamorak's green HP scales between 300,000 and 1,600,000 per player, capping at 1740% enrage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phases 1-5 each take up 16% of the total green HP bar, while phase 6 takes up 20%

⬥ At 100%+ enrage, Zamorak will gain an additional 7th phase that will be explained in its own section

​

docs.title: Special Attacks
docs.text:
⬥ Channelers

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Automatically triggered upon phasing Zamorak from green HP into grey HP

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A message will appear saying Zamorak begins to draw power and energy from something within Infernus. , this will spawn a Chaos Witch Channeler in Infernus

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players must enter Infernus with the extra action button and defeat the witch before being able to charge the next pad

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The witch has 33,000 health + 132 for every 10 enrage increase

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is advised to / before towards the witch since it is able to stun

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At 500%, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 50% adrenaline and their first ability is

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At 1000%+, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 100% adrenaline and their first ability is

​

⬥ Flames of Zamorak

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will yell This world will burn. and slam into the ground, dealing 2 melee hits and spawning a line of black smoke between himself and a player

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The melee slam deals more damage the closer the player is to Zamorak, and more smoke will be spawned the further the player is

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Picking up the smoke by walking over it will start a timer over the player that deals typeless damage at the end

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The damage increases and gains additional defence piercing the more smoke that is picked up

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If the smoke is left on the ground, Zamorak will gain stacks reducing his damage taken

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ See Hex: Twinshot further down for additional timing notes

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To deal with this, be close to the boss to ensure that minimum smoke will spawn, , use defensives if low HP, and use / on the timed damage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Entering Infernus with the timer running will detonate the damage immediately with increased defence piercing

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In group, players standing on the northeast side of Zamorak are higher priority to be targeted for the smoke

​

Flames of Zamorak example using +

​

⬥ Adrenaline Cage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will say Chaos, unfettered! then temporarily drops overhead prayers and spawns a cage on the bases' location to bombard with 5 magic attacks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If no player is standing on the cage location, all players will take heavy typeless damage, have their adrenaline drained, and suffer a heavy adrenaline gain debuff

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Remain still, and use / +

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At 1500%+ the player taking the hits will have disabled

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ + from another player will still work

​

⬥ Chaos Blast

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will curl up and begin charging his attack shouting I will tear you asunder!

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During this time Zamorak may be stunned enough (equal to team size) and will require a damage check right after, which will then force him to release the attack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If Zamorak is not stunned the attack will be released after 18 seconds

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He will yell Feel the rage of a god. and send a red projectile that deals damage based on how long he was allowed to charge

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The attack has a base defence piercing of 40%

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use a combination of defensives / / / , at higher enrages you may opt to simply not stun and instead

​

⬥ Infernal Tomb

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak says Step into the dark... meet your death., assigns a rune over each players' head, and transports them to Infernus where chaos demons (amount equal to team size) are marching towards a portal to the main arena

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Each Chaos Demon has 15,000 - 70,000 health , capping at 1470% enrage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Use abilities such as / to keep the demon(s) in place and kill them

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players must go to the same corresponding rune they received overhead to exit Infernus

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Going to the wrong rune will deal heavy damage to all players

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As players are sent into Infernus at the beginning of the mechanic, Zamorak will start charging his Chaos Blast mechanic, with only the stun portion required to force him to release the attack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ It is highly suggested to pre-stun Zamorak to keep this damage manageable without

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Example clip of proper stun timing here.

​

⬥ Rune of Destruction

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak will say You're already dead. ‎and lay a massive red rune around him with a disc-shaped gap

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black sludge will spawn SSW (South South-West) of the rune and rotate clockwise or counterclockwise sometimes changing direction and stuns those who get hit by it twice

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The red areas deal constant typeless damage to those standing in it

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The player cannot teleport to Infernus for the duration of the attack

​

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The rune can be divided in 12 pineapple pizza slices as showed in the diagram, the black sludge occupies 2 and always moves in steps of 1 slice

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The black sludge will either spawn in 12-11 moving clockwise or in 1-2 moving counterclockwise

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The black sludge will move around the ring, changing position every 2 ticks, 18 times

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ The black sludge can randomly change the direction it is moving towards up to 2 times

​

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using the image below, you can position yourself in optimal spots depending on the spawn point of the black sludge

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This will buy more time to react to the sludges' movement, allowing you to stay in your damage-boosting ultimates

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If you are unsure, starting SSW, or between 12 and 1 in the diagram, will assure that you won't be hit twice and stunned on the first rotation

docs.title: Special Attack Order
docs.text:
The following diagram outlines the pattern of special attacks used by and how they vary based on when you transition between phases:

⬥ The special attack order updates to a new phase when red HP is depleted. Special attacks that occur during red HP will still use the previous attack order from green HP

⬥ Zamorak's first special attack in red HP will carry over auto attacks from the previous green HP phase

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• E.g. if Zamorak uses Adrenaline Cage in phase 3 followed by 2 autoattacks before phasing into grey HP, after the next pad is charged Zamorak will use 3 autoattacks followed by Chaos Blast, then resume using special attacks in 10-autoattack intervals

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 1 red HP doesn't have a previous green HP so the first special attack will simply happen after 10 autoattacks

⬥ Zamorak's first special attack in green HP will always happen after 1 autoattack before he resumes using special attacks in 5-autoattack intervals

​

docs.title: Hexes and Edicts
docs.text:
⬥ Charge Pads

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The arena has 6 pads that you can stand on to charge.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When it is fully charged, Zamorak will stop attacking for a while and your adrenaline bar will be refilled. After this, you will gain an Edict while Zamorak gains a Hex depending on the pad charged.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will become unable to charge pads during the Channelers mechanic. To continue charging the next pad, you must enter Infernus and kill the witch present.

​

⬥ Hexes and Edicts

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every time a pad is charged, all players and Zamorak will gain a stack of currently active stacking edicts and hexes, respectively

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This makes it such that earlier pad effects become stronger as the fight progresses

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Note that pads 3 and 5 don't have stacking effects

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ E.g. if you activate pads 2 → 4 → 1 → 3 → 6 → 5, once 5 is activated rune 2 will have 6 stacks, rune 4 will have 5 stacks, rune 1 will have 4 stacks, and rune 6 will have 2 stacks

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During phase 7, all stacking edicts and hexes have their stack amounts reversed

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ E.g. Using the pad order in the above example, phase 7 will act as if the pad order were 5 → 6 → 3 → 1 → 4 → 2

⬥ A calculator has been made to gauge the effects of each activated Edict & Hex: https://runescape.wiki/w/Calculator:Combat/Rune_pads

​

Hexes and Edicts Hex: Twinshot, Edict: Anima Flow (Stacking) ⬥ Zamorak's attacks deal a second hit at 10% of the original hit, per stack. ⬥ Player's basic abilities have their adrenaline gain increased by 20% of the original value, per stack. ​ Hex: Smite, Edict: Haste (Stacking) ⬥ If Zamorak's targets are hit below 5% (per stack) of their Constitution level (times 100), they'll be executed instantly. ⬥ Your ability cooldowns are reduced by 8% of the original cooldown per stack. ​ Hex: Coven, Edict: Inner Chaos (Non-Stacking) ⬥ Zamorak calls forth some of his coven to support him. Lifeweaver will continually heal Zamorak for 1,000 health every few ticks, while Protector applies a buff that reduces the damage he takes by 25%. These enemies will spawn to the far west and east (by the second and fifth runes) respectively, but will not move towards Zamorak until a player is in mini-map range of them. ⬥ When standing near a hexed rune, you deal and take 5% more damage. ​ Hex: Disintegrate, Edict: Guardian's Triumph (Stacking) ⬥ Zamorak's attacks push 7% of damage through any shielding effects, per stack. ⬥ After casting an ultimate ability, your next basic ability consumes Guardian's Triumph, increasing the damage it deals by 20% damage and heals you for 8% of your missing LP per stack. Has a 30s cooldown. ​ Hex: Chaos Traps, Edict: Sword of Edicts (Non-Stacking) ⬥ Upon activation, Zamorak spawns traps across the arena that deal spike magic damage as you walk over them. Traps will spawn around the arena and on all runes each time a rune is activated. ⬥ Temporarily siphon the dwindling defensive power from the sword, dealing and taking 5% less damage while standing near it. Also protects against the damage, stun and bind when setting off Chaos Traps. Lasts 30 seconds and has a 60 second cooldown. ​ Hex: Affliction, Edict: Balance of Power (Stacking) ⬥ When Zamorak's targets heal, the amount will be reduced by 10% per stack. ⬥ While below 60% lifepoints, outgoing damage is increased by 6% per stack. ​

​

docs.title: Hex: Twinshot
docs.text:
Twinshot from pad 1 and Disintegrate from pad 4 will result in the largest increases in incoming damage, especially when they are ramped up in later phases

​

⬥ Twinshot deals a second hit 1 tick after all of Zamorak's autoattacks, equal to 10% of the possible max hit per stack, which allows for less uptime and creates special hit timings to be wary of once it's active

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During grey HP and red HP, Zamorak will have an accelerated 4-tick attack rate, meaning will have to be active 1/2 of the time with twinshot active

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the Flames of Zamorak mechanic, if the black smoke is picked up immediately, the timed damage will occur on the same tick as a twinshot hit during grey HP and red HP

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This will make it impossible to / the timed damage unless is also used

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Note that entering Infernus or phasing Zamorak between red HP/grey HP and green HP, causing his attack speed to change, while the timer is running can cause the damage to line up with an attack regardless of twinshot being active or not

​

docs.title: Hex: Disintegrate
docs.text:
⬥ Disintegrate from pad 4 grants Zamorak 7% defence piercing per stack on his attacks, stacking with existing defence piercing values such as Chaos Blast: 40% and Flames of Zamorak Smoke damage: 1% per stack

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This only affects the following defensives:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Disruption shield

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Barricade

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Resonance

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Divert

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Reflect

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Debilitate

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Shield dome

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The % damage taken through a defensive affected by disintegrate is calculated as follows

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ = floor(Defensive_value * (Disintegrate_stacks * 0.07 + Base_piercing) + (100 - Defensive_value))/100​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Given the way some defensives are calculated through this effect, this results in a buff and debuff on certain aspects of them:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Reflect damage increases as more damage taken results in more damage reflected

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Resonance healing decreases since disintegrate results in less damage blocked

​

docs.title: Hex: Chaos Traps
docs.text:
Once the Chaos Traps rune is active from pad 5, traps will spawn in set locations. The locations on the map below are possible locations where the traps may spawn

⬥ Note that traps respawn on every pad each time a new pad is charged

⬥ To avoid being stunned and taking heavy damage, you can:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Step off each pad right as it finishes charging (new traps spawn with a slight delay)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Pick up the buff near the sword before charging a new pad

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• + + / / to step on a new pad without the buff

​

docs.title: Phase 7
docs.text:
At 100% enrage, phase 7 is introduced. Zamorak will enter Infernus and force the player in along with them.

⬥ When the phase starts:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The pad order from phases 1-6 is reversed

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak starts immune to damage

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Chaos Demon will spawn which should be killed

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zamorak sends 2 hits to all players

docs.title: Rune Calls
docs.text:
⬥ An amount of runes (2 in solo, otherwise equal to team size in group) will appear before Zamorak and stay there temporarily, the order in which they appear is the order they must be defeated in

⬥ At the same time Zamorak will begin charging a new red HP bar, referred to as the chaos bar, that determines the damage of upcoming mechanics

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• may be shown twice

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Killing a rune will delay Zamorak from charging for 9 ticks (4 ticks at 1600%+ enrage)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Killing a rune out of order will deal heavy damage to all players

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Runes uber heal after they are defeated, be careful not to kill it twice.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The rate of charge increases with enrage and caps at 8850%

​

⬥ After the last rune is defeated Zamorak stops charging, becomes damageable, and uses in this order:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [1] A single moderate hit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [2] A large chaos damage hit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Soft typeless damage that is equivalent to the chaos bar that charges while killing runes

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Make sure your team is spread out as it does damage in a small area around each player

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Has a base defence piercing of 50%

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [3] 4 additional small chaos damage hits

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Deals damage based on a portion of the chaos bar and the amount of time it was allowed to charge for

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Does not have base defence piercing but is affected by Twinshot

​

⬥ If Zamorak is not defeated before becoming immune on the 4th small chaos hit:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [4] Another Chaos Demon spawns

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [5] Another moderate hit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [6] Another large chaos damage hit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• [7] Runes are called

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Resets to [1] once last rune is defeated

​

⬥ Zamorak will have 100,000 to 250,000 health per player during phase 7, capping at 1000% enrage

⬥ The Chaos Demon is the same as during the Infernal Tomb mechanic and will have 18,750 to 70,000 health , capping at 1470% enrage

⬥ At 1000% enrage the chaos bar charge no longer resets between cycles, meaning the chaos damage will likely become unmanageable in a second cycle

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It's generally expected for Zamorak to be low enough at this point to defeat before the large chaos hit reaches the player, can also be used to buy more time

​

⬥ Each small chaos damage hit is calculated as follows:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎= floor(Iteration * Chaos_bar/100) ‎where Iteration ‎refers to how many times the Charge value has increased (this gets delayed when killing a rune)

​

Final phase (Solo 440%)

​

docs.title: Phase 7 General Strategy
docs.text:
​

After entering Infernus:

⬥ Team kills the Chaos Demon

⬥ Team kills runes as soon as they appear, being careful not to kill them twice unintentionally

⬥ Before killing the last rune, team gets ready to ult and deal as much damage as possible in a short amount of time, making sure to be spread out

⬥ Team kills last rune and immediately get on Zamorak

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will want to and the melee hit

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use + + on the large hit, less defensives will be required with lower (<10k) charge

⬥ Repeat cycle if necessary

​

Note: See enrage and style-specific Zamorak guides for full working rotations

​

docs.title: Phase 7 Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Taking too much damage? Note: refer to !p7skulls in #bot-commands if struggling with bouncing to runes ⬥ Edict Order (see !edicts for recommendations)     • A late edict 4 leads to less effective defensives.     • An early edict 6 leads to lesser healing food. ⬥ Rune Killing Speed     • Killing the first rune immediately is imperative as Zamorak's red bar stops charging for 10 ticks (5 ticks at 1600+ enrage) following each rune death. The red bar directly correlates to the damage you receive. ⬥ Defensive Usage     • Pre- and the initial hit?     • + and the Large Smoke?             • Full hp when using ? Not dealing enough damage to one-cycle? ⬥ Damage Checklist     • Delaying / / / until after the Large Smoke?             • This is to benefit from edict 6 effect (low HP damage bonus)     • Stacking 7+ during p1-6 and using ?     • Using / to reach Zamorak after final Rune death? ⬥ Preparing for a Second Cycle     • the 2nd melee hit, +       OR     • + the 2nd melee hit,

​

docs.title: Enrage-Based Mechanics
docs.text:
Zamorak's damage and HP scales with enrage, and additional mechanics are introduced at specific enrage thresholds:

​

⬥ 100% Phase 7 is introduced

⬥ 500% During Infernal Tomb, all players must be on their rune at the same time to exit Infernus

⬥ 500% During Channelers, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 50% adrenaline and the first ability is Asphyxiate

⬥ 750% During Infernal Tomb, demons will move faster towards the portal

⬥ 900% During Channelers, grey HP healing ramp-up no longer resets between phases

⬥ 1000% During Channelers, Chaos Witch Channeler spawns with 100% adrenaline and their first ability is Omnipower

⬥ 1000% On phase 7, red bar charge is no longer reset between cycle(s)

⬥ 1000% On phase 7, Zamorak's life points cap at 250,000 per player

⬥ 1470% The life points of chaos demons cap at 70,000 while on Infernus

⬥ 1500% During the Adrenaline Cage attack, the targeted player will have their Devotion deactivated

⬥ 1600% Zamorak's stagger after killing a rune on Phase 7 reduced from 10 to 5 ticks

⬥ 1740% For phases 1-6, Zamorak's starting life points cap at 1,600,000 per player

⬥ 3500% On phase 7, the life points the runes revive with are capped at 60,000

​

docs.title: Helpful Tips
docs.text:
⬥ Grey HP won't regenerate on the ticks Zamorak takes damage, meaning DoT abilities such as / / / can be used before entering Infernus to prevent some healing

⬥ As Infernal Tomb starts, you can on tick stun Zamorak by using / as he assigns runes and using a stun as your character is lifted. Example clip of proper stun timing here.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This will greatly reduce the damage dealt to players

⬥ You can stack to use with during phase 7

⬥ At high enrages the base can use or to reduce the damage dealt by autos

⬥ Ring of Death effect clears upon entering phase 7

⬥ You may other players and if multiple players will take a fatal attack at the same time

​

docs.text:
Abyssal beasts are a higher level alternative for Abyssal Slayer creature assignments. They are mainly killed for Slayer tasks, the Senntisten collection log, combat / item experience, profit, and

​

⬥ Abyssal beasts can be assigned as a Slayer assignment by Mandrith, Laniakea, Morvran, Kuradal, Duradel, Sumona, and The Raptor.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Abyssal beasts specific tasks may be assigned by Mandrith.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Demon cluster tasks also work, they may be assigned by Laniakea, and The Raptor.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Laniakea assigns almost twice as many.

⬥ The level 35 Wilderness location yields the highest kph.

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text:
Owning the following increases the efficiency of your sessions, but is by no means mandatory. Items ⬥ Slayer Codex     • Once 50 souls are added, it can be used to teleport to the Sunken Pyramid. ⬥ Portable obelisk / Obelisk shard     • Allows for an easy teleport to the lvl 35 wilderness obelisk. ⬥ Demon horn necklace and attuned ectoplasmator     • Helps sustain your prayer. ⬥ Dwarven siege engine or Kinetic cyclone     • Make sure to have the Restocking Cannon ability unlocked. Other ⬥ Armour perked with Demon Slayer     • +7% damage against demons. ⬥ Stone of Jas buff     • 3% damage bonus for 4 hours after visiting the cave. ⬥ Infernal Puzzle Box (tier 6)     • 14% damage reduction and 9% damage increase whilst in the Wilderness.         ⬩ This effect scales with the tier of your puzzle box.     • Tier 6 allows you to put it in your tool belt.

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get there
docs.text:
Abyssal beasts can be fought in the Senntisten Asylum, the Wilderness, or the Sunken Pyramid.

​

Senntisten Asylum

⬥ If killing Abyssal beasts at the Senntisten Asylum, use a

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Go to the second room of the Senntisten Asylum and position yourself 5 tiles east of the west drain.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place 4 tiles east of you.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ If using an place it 3 tiles north of you.

​

Level 35 Wilderness

⬥ If killing Abyssal beasts at the level 35 Wilderness location, use a

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Go just north of the level 35 Wilderness obelisk and position yourself two tiles north of the skeleton.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ A beast might get stuck initially but this won't happen when it respawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place 1 tile north of you.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This location yields the highest kph.

​

Sunken Pyramid

⬥ If killing Abyssal beasts in the Sunken Pyramid, use a

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Relocating your house to Menaphos and using a teleport to house tablet also works.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Place 5 Abyssal beasts in the small room, and position yourself six tiles south of the northern statue (northeastern corner of the brazier's shadow).

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get there
docs.text:
The best spot for abyssal demons is located at the level 18 Wilderness obelisk (Graveyard of Shadows). The fastest way to reach the location is using the portable obelisk or an obelisk shard.

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Acheron mammoths are one of the 4 raptor mobs and have the highest HP of the bunch. Although they give decent slayer XP, they don't drop any rare uniques and thus are the least popular of the raptor creatures. They attack with melee and ranged, with their ranged attack having the animation of throwing a ice ball. This attack is dodge-able always hits if it lands, dealing moderately heavy ranged damage.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ XP per kill : 4215.6

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~375 (High Effort), 290 (Low Effort)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~1.58M (High effort), 1.22M (Low effort)

​

docs.title: Desirable Drops
docs.text:
⬥ Guaranteed unique drop every kill of a Mammoth Tusk, which is an ingredient in making Pack Mammoth pouches.

⬥ In addition to this, they have a rich drop table, making the tasks decent for GP alongside XP. Mammoths also provide a large amount of crimson and blue charms, dropping 4 at a time.

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
⬥ Mammoths can be found in 2 locations:

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Mammoth Iceberg - Accessible via a boat to the north of the Fremennik Lodestone.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This location is used if AoE slaying actively due to having more spawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Methods to get there (fastest to slowest): Fairy Ring D K S > Fremennik lode > Fremennik boots teleport

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Frozen Waste Plateau

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This location is used if slaying Mammoths low effort due to it benefiting from

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Teleport there using the Ice Plateau teleport (Lunar spellbook).

​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text: Freedom ⬥ When stunned for bound, mammoths will shout 'Freedom!' and remove any stuns and binds. This does not clear bleeds. ​ Dishonourable conduct ⬥ When damaged out of melee distance of the player, the mammoth may fling 3 ice balls at the player, each dealing heavy ranged damage. Getting hit will disable all prayers, drain all run energy, and bind the player.     • This is the mechanic with by far the highest kill potential. Try to keep in melee distance when attacking mammoths at all costs.     • It is suicidal to use  to aggro mammoths due to this mechanic. ​ Charge ⬥ The mammoth shakes and a blue bar above its head starts filling up. When the bar fills, the mammoth does 1-3 charges, pushing the player and dealing heavy melee damage each charge.     • To avoid this, simply pray  and allow it to hit you, or move out of the way.     • If being attacked by more than 1 mammoth, the displacement from this attack may trigger Dishonourable conduct from another mammoth, which can easily kill the player.

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text: Items ⬥ Dominion Mines      • Useful for doing Mammoths actively. ⬥ Magic notepaper      • Useful for noting mammoth tusks for extra GP. ​ Passives/Unlocks ⬥ Stone of Jas buff      • Damage boost to mammoths in the wilderness. ⬥ Infernal Puzzle box      • Damage boost to mammoths in the wilderness. ⬥ Aggression      • Useful for pulling spawns to AoE.

docs.title: Method: Active Melee
docs.text:
Melee is the best method for mammoths, as you need to be in melee distance as much as possible due to Dishonourable conduct. Additionally, melee has abundant AoE which hits around the player, making it perfect for killing multiple mammoths as you want to position in the middle of mammoths as much as possible.

​

Armoured phantoms are the highest tiered Zemouregal's undead, requiring 113 to kill. Even though their drops are worth less than that of other similar high-levelled slayer monsters such as abyssal lords and moss golems , they offer competitive EXP rates and make for a fairly speedy task.

docs.title: Greater demon berserkers and ash lords
Introduction
docs.text:
Greater demon variants found southwest of Elite Dungeon 2 and within the Zamorakian undercity elite dungeon are significantly stronger than standard greater demons.

​

⬥ The two wilderness variants of enhanced greater demons attack using melee (berserker) and magic (ash lord). The wilderness population is weaker than those found in the Zamorakian undercity and are poisonable . Along with access to buffs, this makes them ideal for slayer training.

​

⬥ Since they don't have any unique drops, a can be used for additional slayer XP. This makes greater demon berserkers and ash lords some of the best AFK slayer exp in the game.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This also means there's no reason to do them off-task.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ level: 1

⬥ XP per kill: 7150

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~185 and (All AFK)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour: ~1.3m and (All AFK)

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text: Items ⬥ Scrimshaw of sacrifice      • Increases slayer XP gained by 1.5X and removes all drops obtained.     • Losses are negligible as demons do not have any uniques or otherwise valuable drops. ⬥ Kwuarm incense sticks      • A large portion of your damage comes from poison. ⬥ Jas demonbane arrows      • Best in slot demon slaying ammo if using ranged. ⬥ Demon slayer equipment      • Best in slot demon slaying armour if using ranged.     • Bring 3 pieces and 1 piece of augmented power armour with  and  ​ Passive unlocks ⬥ Tier 3 guardhouse     • Due to the high amount of HP of the demons, the chance for ultimates to instakill  is highly beneficial for this task. ⬥ Restocking Cannon Ability     • Allows  restocking without user input, essential for AFKing.

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Use the dragonkin laboratory teleport or a portal attuned to the Elite dungeon via War's Retreat. Exit via the southwest to enter the wilderness.

​

docs.title: General strategy
docs.text:
Enhanced greater demon variants possess high damage and cannot be recklessly AoE'd unlike many other slayer mobs. Hence, it would be best to safespot them or at most tank 2 of them at once.

​

⬥ Players who do not possess end game equipment may utilise a safespot west of the dungeon as shown below:

⬥ More information on placement and demonstration may be found here

⬥ Players who are well-geared and can afford to tank their attacks may run south and position themselves on a small peninsula as shown below, using a to aggro the demons.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This spot allows you to lure 5 demons in total (3 ash lords + 2 berserkers), and limits the number of demons attacking you to at most 2 at once (1 Ash lord + 1 Berserker) as other demons will be stuck behind.

docs.title: Method: AFK Magic/Ranged
docs.text:
With high end gear, both and can be used to AFK the demons, at around the same rates.

​

⬥ When you need to repair the , quickly out, click, and then back to the suggested spot.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Check that the demons did not walk in a way which gets them stuck.

​

**Note: ** During the initial lure, the demons may get stuck in a conformation that makes them unable to approach you, to resolve this, kill the initial wave and then walk back to the suggested spot.

docs.title: Example Block/Prefer Lists
docs.text:
Note: The following block/prefer lists are just examples, it’s always more efficient to make your own.

​

⬥ It's assumed the player will slay Moss Golems for Creatures of the Lost Grove tasks and Ripper Demons for Demon cluster tasks, as well as bringing Binding Contracts for GP.

⬥ These lists are made for use with Laniakea

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Before level 90, when you can't use her as your Slayer Master, its generally not worth thinking too hard about your block/prefer list, and you can just block tasks you don't like or find unrewarding.

​

Block/Prefer List for XP:

Block ⬥ Aviansies ⬥ Black Demons ⬥ Kalphites ⬥ Dagannoths ⬥ Dark Beasts ⬥ Mutated Jadinkos ⬥ Order of Ascension members ⬥ Steel Dragons Prefer ⬥ Abyssal Demons ⬥ Creatures of the Lost Grove ⬥ Demons ⬥ Living Wyverns ⬥ Gemstone Dragons ⬥ Nightmare Creatures ⬥ Ripper Demons ⬥ Acheron Mammoths

​

Block/Prefer List for GP:

Block ⬥ Kalphites ⬥ Black Demons ⬥ Greater Demons ⬥ Aviansies ⬥ Dagannoths ⬥ Vile Blooms ⬥ Order of Ascension members ⬥ Shadow Creatures Prefer ⬥ Profane Scabarites ⬥ Creatures of the Lost Grove ⬥ Demons ⬥ Living Wyverns ⬥ Kal'gerion Demons ⬥ Nightmare Creatures ⬥ Ripper Demons ⬥ Abyssal Demons

​

docs.title: Personalised Spreadsheet
docs.text:
⬥ Configuring the spreadsheet below is an easy way to find the best Block/Prefer list for your personal use.

⬥ Be aware of the Slayer collection log while blocking monsters, and whether it's something you have interest in filling out or not.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the Slayer collection log is something you're interested in doing, check out our full guide on obtaining Ultimate Slayer, which has an alternative block/prefer list included.

​

Customisable Block/Prefer Spreadsheet ⬥ Click File > Make a copy top left for a personal copy. ⬥ Toggle the Home page settings to match what you use.     • The Misc section is for unlisted XP modifiers, e.g. enter 10 if you have an unlisted 10% XP buff. ⬥ Enter your KPH in the column on the right of the Experience page.     • You can select tasks to lock, force prefer/block, and that you use for here as well. ⬥ Select the focus of your Slaying in the next page's dropdown menu and copy the displayed Block and Prefer list.

​

docs.title: Additional Information
docs.text:
⬥ Players start with a only a few slots to block/prefer monsters, gaining 1 of each every 50 Quest Points achieved, up to a maximum of 8 slots to block and prefer monsters at 400 Quest Points.

⬥ Don't be afraid to skip undesired or bad assignments, as you can skip around half of the tasks given by Laniakea without losing many Slayer points overall, and they can be farmed with relative ease, making it unnecessary to force yourself to do any tasks you dislike.

⬥ The assignment given by your Slayer Master is not completely random, a system unique to each Slayer Master known as weighting is used to make some assignments more common than others, and may be a factor in what the player chooses to block/prefer.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The higher the weighting, the more common the assignment compared to others, the weighting for each task a Slayer Master has can be viewed on their page of the RuneScape Wiki.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As we can see from the image below, Jacquelyn has a slightly higher chance to assign us Cows, Goblins, or Zombies.

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Camel Warriors are one of the 4 Raptor Mobs, generally killed for the collection log. As such, they should only be killed on task where they are 5x more likely to drop the

​

⬥ Camel warriors have one main mechanic - After taking some damage, they split into 3 mirages - Blood, Smoke and Shadow. Each has their own unique abilities. All attack with magic.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Shadow mirages - Drains points after charging their overhead bar.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood mirages - Heal other mirages for ~900 HP per attack.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Smoke mirages - Cast the Confuse, Weaken and Snare spells on the player, reducing hitchance and damage by 5%, and freezing you in place for 10s respectively.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ After the mirages have been killed, the camel warrior re-appears with the HP it had before phasing, and can now be finished off.

​

⬥ Mirages can be bypassed by dealing a singular hit of more than 20,125 damage, before hitcaps apply.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For example, if is used on task in with 120 , it will be capped at 15K, but in theory it would've dealt 30K damage, so the camel will not be phased. This will then allow the player to finish off the camel by dealing the remaining 5125 damage in 1 hit.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the player fails to deal 5125 damage in the next hit, the camel will phase into mirages. This is why perks such as crackling and aftershock should be avoided when relying on methods that skip the mirage mechanic.

​

⬥ All methods suggested below use tricks that bypass the mechanic entirely, as it is very time consuming and detrimental to kph to kill Camel warriors "normally".

​

docs.title: Method: Active Melee [PoSD]
docs.text:
The fastest way to kill camels relies on doing trips to a player owned dungeon with 3-4 camel warriors, using and trying to kill as many camels as possible within the duration while skipping the mirage mechanic. It also requires essentially best in slot melee gear to be as consistent as possible.

​

⬥ 2023-AUG-29 - IMPORTANT NOTE

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After changes which made the enhanced variant not reset-able with the War's Retreat crystal, this method is significantly worse and will not be able to achieve the advertised kph. However, it is likely still better than methods which involves dealing with camel spawns.

​

⬥ Occasionally, the camel will not phase despite hitting for significantly less than 20,000. When this happens, use a 188 to guarantee the kill on the camel. or may not deal sufficient raw damage to finish the camel off.

​

  1. Use at War's Retreat with equipped + Kalg spec

  2. Swap to and get back 90% or more adrenaline before teleporting to the Menaphos house portal.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. Use a Menaphos tablet or the House teleport spell if your house is attuned to Menaphos.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b. You can activate from action bar without interrupting adren gaining if not on full HP.

  1. Travel to the sunken pyramid with Kags (option 1).

  2. Enter the dungeon using right click. You should fall out of combat and Persistent Rage should start topping your adrenaline off until 120% around this time.

  3. Do a → walk diagonal → + to get to whichever large dungeon hosts your camels (diagram below).

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The after a guarantees a kill.

⬥ In an ideal run, you should be able to get 7-8 camel KC.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you get a and lucky crits, a 9 kill run is possible.

⬥ When you fail a skip, use (tc) + to avoid getting rooted and try to spend as much of your adrenaline as possible on other spawns before teleporting out.

⬥ If you run out of adrenaline and still have time on , use (tc) + defensive basics until you have enough adrenaline for another (22.5%)

docs.text:
Capsarius are the healers of the Order of Ascension. They are mainly killed for Ascension members Slayer tasks, the Feldip Hills collection log, and Ascension Keystones in the Sunken Pyramid.

⬥ This guide will focus on killing Capsarius in the Sunken Pyramid, as this location yields the highest kills per hour.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Capsarius have weak attacks, don't heal each other, and have low health which makes them very easy to farm.

⬥ Ascension members can be assigned as a Slayer assignment by Duradel, Kuradal, Morvran, and Laniakea.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Edimmu are undead slayer monster requiring 90 and 115 to kill. They are a task-only monster so players going for the Daemonheim log are strongly advised to prioritise picking this monster whenever procs. The player can only access the Edimmu area if on a slayer task or holding slayer wildcards.

​

⬥ Besides the default Edimmu tasks, you can also kill Edimmu for the following tasks:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Creatures of Daemonheim

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Undead

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ghosts

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Zombies

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ XP per kill : 1600 + 528

⬥ XP per kill : 880.2

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~585 (530 AFK)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour: ~515K (466K AFK)

​

docs.title: Desirable drops
docs.text:
⬥ Edimmu pet - 1/512 only from Elites

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer log.

⬥ Blood Necklace shards

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text: Item unlocks ⬥ Enhanced luck potion      • Spawns more Elites and increases pet droprate to 1/496. ⬥ Ghost hunter equipment      • Each piece provides a 3% damage boost. ⬥ Salve amulet (e)      • Best in slot for killing Edimmu. ⬥ Slayer wildcards      • Helpful for killing an Elite if one spawns right as the task ends. ​ Passive unlocks ⬥ Undead slayer (perk)  and Genocidal      • Increases damage and KPH.     •  should be on the armour used to kill Edimmus as you are always on task. ⬥ Undead slayer (sigil)      • Increases damage and kph if slaying actively. ⬥ Restocking Cannon Ability     • Allows  restocking without user input.

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Edimmu are slayer monsters found within the Edimmu dungeon, which is located in the Meilyr district of Prifddinas and requires 115 to be assessed. The best way to get there would be the teleport straight to the dungeon, or by teleporting to the Meilyr district via a teleport seed.

​

docs.title: General strategy
docs.text:
Despite looking large, Edimmus are 1x1, with Elites being 2x2. This makes it viable to use strategies which involve stacking them up and then AoEing them down.

​

⬥ For both active and AFK methods, position your cannon as shown below.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If AFKing, stand in the position as shown below.

docs.title: Method: Jacquelyn tasks
docs.text:
If going for pet, as each slayer task forces an Elite spawn, a good way to farm Elites is via the slayer master Jacquelyn. This is done by killing Edimmu during a Zombie or Ghost task which forces an Elite spawn every 15 kills with slayer introspection.

​

docs.title: Method: Active Ranged
docs.text:
The active strategy for Edimmu involves aggroing as many as possible, luring them to a barrier and then chinning them down. This method also works with melee if using a , but ranged has a much easier experience. Additionally, less damage is taken using ranged as Edimmus primarily attack with magic.

​

⬥ Generally this method is only recommended for relatively ungeared players, as players with good magic equipment can AFK the task obtaining a slightly lower kph.

​

⬥ The kph of killing Edimmu actively is highly limited by their slow spawn timers.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text: Preset Suggestions ⬥ Ranged - Active

docs.title: Strategy
docs.text:
⬥ When a bunch of Edimmu are aggro'd onto you, step behind the barrier and wait for the Edimmu to fill in the space immediately before the barrier.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When Edimmus are in position, immediately enter to avoid losing Edimmu aggression and target the center Edimmu.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rough ability priority with : > > >

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is easier to target the normal Edimmu around the Elite and chin them down together.

​

⬥ A can be a viable familiar for this task.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Store some food it in case you mess up Elite Edimmu spawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use it to store rare drop table drops, sharks, or unstackable drops (e.g. crystal seeds).

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Winter Storage can be used to bank untradeable drops like attuned crystal weapon/armour seeds or

​

⬥ While waiting for Edimmu to respawn, you can run around to aggro and kill stray Edimmu not tagged by the cannon.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• or are good options for mass-aggroing.

​

⬥ If done right, you will be able to kill at least 585 per hour.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This will vary a little depending on the number of Elite spawns.

​

⬥ is not needed for the method to work well.

​

docs.title: Method: AFK Magic
docs.text:
Edimmu are best AFK'd using a staff with caroming along with gchain . The gear required strongly depends on the player's effort in dealing with Elite Edimmu. Even though Edimmu themselves do not deal much damage and can be out healed with mage's AoE easily, Elites pose a huge problem if trying to AFK with subpar gear and will require the player to click back and take measures to kill the Elite (e.g. laying , eating food).

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
There are three species of gemstone dragons - Dragonstone dragons, Onyx dragons, and Hydrix dragons.

​

⬥ To kill them off-task in gemstone mines, you need to buy KC through these following uncut gems:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• - Allows 2 kills each

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• - Allows 400 kills each

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• - Allows 4000 kills each

​

⬥ If killing them in the wilderness or Dragonkin Laboratory , payment is not needed.

​

⬥ Due to their low profitability but relatively high EXP rates, they should be only be killed on-task for slayer EXP and heavily improved rare drop rates.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All presets hence assume buffs are active on the Anachronia helmet stand.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For active methods, ranged is preferred with and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For AFK methods with is better, although methods are still available.

​

⬥ Besides autos and standard dragonbreath attacks, each species of gemstone dragon has a special attack which fires out a set of gemstone spikes, creating a 3x3 area centered around the player after a delay, dealing high damage. Additionally, gemstone spikes have the following effects:

⬥ Dragonstone Dragon: Halves the duration of antifires and super antifires.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This does NOT work only on extended super antifires.

⬥ Onyx Dragon: Heals the dragon by up to 5000 LP.

⬥ Hydrix Dragon: Drains adrenaline to 0 and halves adrenaline gain for 15 seconds.

​

docs.title: Desirable Drops
docs.text:
⬥ Besides the Draconic Visage (1/10000) which most dragons drop, different dragons drop the different pieces of Gemstone Armour (T80 hybrid, unaugmentable) required for the Karamja slayer log:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragonstone Dragon: Gemstone Gloves and Boots

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Onyx Dragon: Gemstone Helmet and Greaves

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hydrix Dragon: Gemstone Hauberk

​

⬥ All Gemstone dragons have a static droprate for Armour pieces at a rate of 1/2500 off-task and 1/1000 on-task.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Dragonstone and Onyx Dragons this is then 50% chance to be either of the pieces they can drop.

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
⬥ Gemstone dragons are located below the Shilo Village Mines. A ladder leads to the cavern beside Kelhar, which requires Karamja Gloves 3 or above to access.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The teleport option on Karamja Gloves 3 or higher is the fastest way to access the cavern.

​

⬥ They are also found in the Wilderness Dungeon just south of . The quickest way to get there is by teleporting to using the Slayer Cape , walk south and down the ladder.

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text: Useful Items and Unlocks Improves KPH/Exp rates/QoL.  Item unlocks ⬥ Scrimshaw of Sacrifice      • Can be used for 50% increased  and  exp     • Feasible as dragons have high base  exp and are not killed for profit. ⬥ Dragon slayer gloves      • Can be used as a switch for 15% more  exp, or camped at the cost of slightly less KPH from losing  passive. ⬥ Demon horn necklace      • If AFKing and not using the , players can use this to upkeep prayer points. ​ Passive unlocks ⬥ Restocking Cannon Ability     • Allows  restocking without user input. ⬥ Death ward      • Poor player survivability if hit by gemstone spikes, especially when AFK.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Following the combat style's rapid rise to top of the meta, causing increased usability, Glacors have quickly become one of the best slayer monsters to kill for gold, especially as an AFK option in the Elder God Wars dungeon with low equipment requirements relative to many other comparable AFK methods.

​

They attack with low to moderate-damage melee , ranged , and magic attacks.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ Life Points: 40,000

⬥ XP per kill : 3,979.8 + 1,313.3 HP

⬥ XP per kill : 1,881

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: 200

⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~376k

​

docs.title: Desirable Drops
docs.text:
⬥ Glacors have multiple high-value unique drops, including:

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Shards of Armadyl - Dropped at a rate of approximately 1/9.6 per kill.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Glacyte Boots - Dropped at a rate of 3/1280 per kill, or approximately 1/209 when holding a Most Wanted Card (Glacor).

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elder Trove (Wen, T3) - Dropped at a rate of 8 per hour with the fully upgraded while at the Glacor Front.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fragments of Pernix's Quiver - Though not directly dropped by Glacors, these drop at a rate of approximately 1/9.5 from Elder Trove (Wen, T3).

​

⬥ Shards of Armadyl are a slot on the Lost Lands and Dungeons slayer collection log, and all three boots are slots on both the Lost Lands and Dungeons and Senntisten slayer collection logs.

​

Note: Ritual of the Mahjarrat is required to receive Shards of Armadyl, the bulk of the profit from this monster, even at the Glacor Front.

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Glacors are located in the Glacor Cave, accessible through Fairy Ring code DKQ; or at the Glacor Front in the Elder God Wars Dungeon, accessible south of the Senntisten cathedral or north of the Arch-Glacor

​

Each area has pros and cons:

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Glacor Cave has many more spawns and has a passive damage boost, but it is impossible to reliably afk and Elder Troves cannot be received.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Glacor Front only has 4 spawns and there is no damage boost, but Elder Troves will boost gp/hr greatly and it is possible to afk for very low effort income.

​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text:
⬥ Fire Spell Weakness - Similar to Ice Strykewyrms, Glacors take increased damage from Fire Spells (, , , ) and are likewise completely immune to Water Spells (, , ). Because of this, Magic is by far the preferred style to use while fighting Glacors.

​

⬥ Binding Auto attacks - Periodically, Glacor auto attacks will apply a bind. This can be either completely ignored, or cleared with Freedom .

​

⬥ Ice Spikes - Periodically, Glacors may launch a slow moving icicle projectile at the player which will cause a cluster of Ice Spikes to erupt from the ground dealing 50% of the player's current life points as typeless damage. This can either be ignored or avoided by moving from the tile that was stood on when the icicle was launched.

​

⬥ Block of Ice - While in Melee Distance, Glacors may encase players in a block of ice and begin charging a big attack. This special attack is very similar to Araxxor's cacoon special attack, and can only be broken free from by spam clicking. This attack will never occur outside of melee distance.

​

⬥ Glacytes - Once damaged to 20,000 Life Points, the Glacor will spawn three different minions, each with a unique special property. The Glacor is immune to all damage until all three glacytes are defeated, and will inherit the special property of the last glacyte killed. Unlike the main Glacor, these monsters do not take extra damage from fire spells.

​

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Enduring Glacyte - The Enduring Glacyte takes significantly reduced damage depending on its proximity to the main Glacor, being completely immune to damage if in melee distance to it. Unlike the other two types, Enduring Glacytes are not aggressive to the player when they spawn, and must be damaged to lure them away from the main Glacor.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Sapping Glacyte - The Sapping Glacytes drains 20 prayer points with every auto attack.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unstable Glacyte - The Unstable Glacytes will explode, dealing AoE typeless damage equal to 33% of the players current life points if the bar under its life point bar fills up completely. This attack will also damage nearby glacytes.

​

docs.title: Active Strategy
docs.text:
Aside from smart usage of Sunshine and general cooldown management, the primary difficulty of achieving optimal Glacor KPH is effective dispatching of Glacytes.

Loosely following a rotation similar to this one, it is possible to reach 180-200 KPH.

​

→ Threshold → / → Glacytes spawn

​

(Note: Rotate using one of these rotations to dispatch glacytes, depending on available abilities.)

(Target Enduring Glacyte) (wand) → (4t) (staff)

(Target Enduring Glacyte) →

(Target Enduring Glacyte) →

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Following this, finish off remaining glacytes, prioritising Enduring first.

​

(Target Glacor) → Threshold → Strong Basics

​

Note: It is impossible to target more than one Glacor at a time. Furthermore, you have to wait for the entire death animation to finish before you can target a new Glacor.

​

⬥ Active Preset

(Note: Downgrade gear as necessary.)

⬥ Virtus Book - Caroming 4​

docs.title: AFK Strategy
docs.text:
This method relies on the ability to set up an Oldak coil to aggro the Glacors at the Glacor Front of the Elder God Wars Dungeon. Though requiring Ritual of the Mahjarrat to receive the most valuable drops, this method has very low gear requirements relative to other AFK methods that offer comparable GP/Hr rates. It utilises as many long-range area of effect abilities as possible, as well as damage from the Oldak coil , in order to dispatch glacytes without having to target them.

​

Utilising this method will result in 70-75 KPH AFK.

​

Mandatory Requirements ⬥ Oldak Coil is Placed properly, filled, and active. ⬥ Soul Split is active. ⬥ Overload is active. ⬥ Standing in the correct place, outside of melee distance.

⬥ AFK Preset

(Note: Downgrade gear as necessary.)

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Chain - Though not strictly necessary, usage of this ability will greatly increase the reliability of killing glacytes swiftly.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserker's Fury Relic - Many special attacks will reduce life points greatly, allowing consistent use of this relic for additional damage.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Restocking Royale Cannon upgrade - Received from Artisans' Workshop. This will greatly increase AFK time using this method.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Oldak Coil Upgrade Kit - Increases the reliability of killing glacytes quickly.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Pontifex Shadow Ring - Fully charging this ring with 1,000 of each type of resonant anima will allow Glacors to drop Elder Trove (Wen, T3) at a rate of 8 per hour. This ring must be worn in order to receive its benefits, unless it is overcharged with 5,000 of each type of resonant anima.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Caroming 1+ - This allows all three glacytes to be targeted with Chain, ensuring the enduring glacyte is dealt with very slightly quicker than without the perk.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Normal Magic Spellbook - This allows the use of Telekinetic grab , allowing much easier looting without having to move from your spot.

‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ancient Magic Spellbook - This allows the use of Animate Dead and Exsanguinate , allowing for more consistent kills using significantly lower-end gear set ups.

​

docs.title: Action Bar - Staff
docs.text:
This action bar should be used with 2H magic weapons. The bis 2H magic weapon against Glacors is the Inquisitor staff , but most weapons will work. This bar takes advantage of Sonic Wave not delaying revolution for a tick, unlike Greater Concentrated Blast , allowing for more AoE abilities to be spammed on time.

​

Note: Magma Tempest can be completely omitted if not owned.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Kal'gerion Demons can be killed at two locations outside Daemonheim:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Demonic Ruins in the Wilderness at level 47.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Kal'gerion Demons resource dungeon in Daemonheim.

​

Kal'gerion Demons are primarily killed for the Kal'gerion battle commendation drops which are a requirement for the Trimmed Completionist Cape. They also drop Demon Slayer equipment (T60 Ranged power armour) and an Adrenaline Urn which are requirements for the Daemonheim slayer log and Ultimate Slayer title.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ level: 90

⬥ level: 99+

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• AFK: ~325 kills at 120 using T95 weapons

⬥ XP per kill: 1858.8

⬥ XP per hour: ~604k (AFK) & 632k (Low Effort)

​

⬥ Due to the way Necromancy has been designed, kills per hour will increase as your Necromancy level (and hence accuracy and damage) increases.

​

docs.title: Desirable drops
docs.text:

docs.text: Items ⬥ Wilderness sword 4      • Automatically notes ashes when carried in the inventory. ⬥ Headhunter's thrill      • Since lava strykes cannot be poisoned, there is no glove slot that significantly increases kph. Thus, these can be used for longer tasks. ⬥ Portable fairy ring/Quest cape      • Provides a fast teleport to the Glacor cavern for the Stone of Jas buff  ⬥ Portable obelisk/Obelisk shard     • Used to teleport to the level 35 Obelisk, the fastest way to get to lava strykewyrms. ​ Passive unlocks ⬥ Premier Artefact      • Can be used for longer tasks. ⬥ Stone of Jas buff      • Provides a 4% damage increase against lava strykewyrms. ⬥ Infernal Puzzle box      • Provides a 9% damage increase and 14% damage reduction in the wilderness at max rank. ⬥ Mobile  perk on armour     • Lava strykes are spaced out and spawn moderately slowly. You will need to use movement abilities frequently while waiting for spawns.

docs.text: Place your cannon between the 2 small lava pits as shown below. You will alternate between killing the strykes northwest and southeast of this spot, most of which can be hit by the cannon.

⬥ If 4TAA, stamp on mounds with equipped and input the auto when you see your character do the stomp animation.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Wyverns are one of the 4 raptor mobs, and are known for their unique environmental effects and highly damaging attacks. They offer decent XP, and are a consistent source of GP due to their wyvern bone drops.

​

⬥ The Dragon slayer perk and sigil , along with any other dragon-slaying related items such as , do NOT work on wyverns.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ XP per kill : 1859 + 613.4

⬥ XP per kill : 1878.8

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~760 (~530 AFK)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~1.4M (~995K AFK)

​

docs.title: Desirable Drops
docs.text:
⬥ Wyverns have a rich drop table with a guaranteed drop of Wyvern bones, a valuable item and an ingredient for super prayer potions.

⬥ For the Slayer collection log, Wyverns are also killed for their unique drop, the Wyvern Crossbow , a T85 crossbow dropped at a rate of 1/2000 on task (1/10,000 off-task).

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Living Wyverns are found in 2 locations:

  1. The Asgarnian Ice Dungeon, accessed via a rope in the south of the Skeletal Wyvern room.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. The easiest way to get there would be via dungeoneering cape teleport to the Frost dragon dungeon (0,8)

  1. Northwest of Ghorrock, accessed via the Ghorrock teleport (ancient spellbook)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a. This is the best location as it benefits from the and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b. Wyverns are also attackable from areas without the chill mechanic, making it viable to be stationary and AFK in this location.

​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text: Wyrm breath ⬥ Wyverns have a breath attack different from that of dragons, and requires wyrmfire protection.     • Use wyrmfire potions or elder overload salves to block all damage from this attack. ​ Cavern chill ⬥ Wyverns reside in a habitat which slowly increases the player's cold percentage.     • The higher the chill percentage, the lower the poison damage taken by the player. No poison damage will be taken by players with ~70% chill.     • At ≥25% chill, wyvern attack damage increases to 2500 from around 1300.     • At ≥90% chill, players will be periodically stunned at 8-10s per stun, Never let your chill reach this stage.     • Fires throughout the wyvern habitats and be lit, standing within 2 tiles of them periodically lowers the player's chill percentage.     • This mechanic is avoided completely by standing outside of area affected by cavern chill in the wilderness. ​ Wyrm poison ⬥ Wyverns can inflict poison damage based on the percentage of Cavern chill every 4-5 ticks.     • Antipoison++ halves the damage, but every tick of poison decreases potion duration.     • This mechanic is avoided completely by standing outside of area affected by cavern chill in the wilderness. ​ Varied attacking ⬥ Wyverns can attack with all 3 styles, alongside their breath attack.     • They will attack with primarily  if the player stands in melee range.     • Hence, either stand in melee distance and use  or camp  and out heal their damage through high DPS.

docs.title: Useful Items
docs.text: Items ⬥ Elder overload salve      • By far the best potion to use here due to its wyrmfire protection. ⬥ Upgraded bonecrusher      • Extremely useful for gathering wyvern bones, in combination with Death Note  ​ Passive unlocks ⬥ Stone of Jas buff      • Provides a 5% damage increase against living wyverns in the wilderness. ⬥ Infernal Puzzle box      • Provides a 9% damage increase and 14% damage reduction in the wilderness at max rank. ⬥ Death Note      • An extremely helpful relic to help gather valuable wyvern bones.

docs.title: Method: Active/AFK Magic
docs.text:
Magic is the best style at wyverns by far, due to their weakness to the and damage reduction.

​

⬥ Wyverns are stunnable and bindable, so + can be a powerful combo if using 4TAA. Blood spells help with healing, alongside if required.

​

docs.title: Active Strategy
docs.text:
⬥ If doing them actively with best-in-slot gear, stand close to the most north-western fire in the wilderness spot (refer to example vod), and use target cycle to target wyverns within range. Use whenever is used along with if available.

​

⬥ Use combos opportunistically on any wyverns that wander close to each other.

​

⬥ When eating solid food, such as sharks dropped by wyverns, try to eat them in the tick between the end of a kill and the start of the next kill when you have no target, as this does not reduce adrenaline.

​

⬥ If doing wyverns with lesser gear, an may be used to aggro a limited amount (2-3) of wyverns which makes it more manageable to , as shown here

docs.title: AFK Strategy
docs.text:
⬥ If AFKing, stand south of the area out of range of the cavern chill effect.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If positioned correctly, the chill status icon should not be seen on the debuff bar.

​

⬥ Set your legendary pet to scavenge for noted items along with runes and talismans.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Besides noted items and salvage, soul runes are also valuable common loot.

​

⬥ One possibility for positioning is as follows (may not be optimal):

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
For a creatures of the lost grove task you can choose between three different monsters: Moss Golems, Vinecrawlers and Bulbous crawlers. Moss Golems are the fastest, best xp/hr and best gp/hr, therefore the other ones are only worth doing if you are looking to get a soul.

​

docs.text:
⬥ Cinderbane Gloves - Drop Rate of 1/1500 on task and 1/5000 off task

⬥ Ancient Elven Ritual Shard - Drop Rate of 1/1500 on task and 1/5000 off task

⬥ Torn Grimoire Pages - Drop Rate of 1/512 on task and 1/1536 off task.

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Creatures of the Lost Grove can be accessed through the monolith west of the incandescent wisp colony, west of Yanille.

​

⬥ The easiest way to get there would be through the fairy ring (code B J S) after repairing it with 5 Bittercap mushrooms.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An alternative method is to run west from the Incandescent wisp colony, accessible via the portal in the Max guild garden, the elder divination outfit, or via the fairy ring south of Castle Wars (code B K P).

​

⬥ Alternatively, players can also utilise the Solak boss portal through Max Guild, War's Retreat or the teleport through the grouping system. The exact location for each monster can be found on the map in game.

​

docs.text:

To prevent taking too much damage, the Enhanced Devoted or cryptbloom are extremely important for survivability, as you will be praying regardless of which method you are using.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The quest Fate of the Gods is a requirement to fight Nihils or get them as a slayer task. Despite being a Nihil, Nex is not affected by being on a task.

​

⬥ As Nihils are not technically demons, the various demon slayer buffs do not work on them.

​

⬥ They are permanently aggressive unless the player is wielding a Shard of Zaros and run at the same speed as the player.

​

⬥ Each nihil variant has their own unique special they will use after a few autos.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Smoke nihil: Reduces combat stats.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ This effect is easily nullified by overloads.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Shadow nihil: Deals 500 typeless damage 3 times.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood nihil: Stops attacking, becomes invulnerable to styled damage and absorbs incoming damage.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Blood Nihils will not heal from damage in a player-owned dungeon.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Poison will still damage them normally.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ice nihil: Drains 50 prayer points per attack. Also stuns and binds the player

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ These rates are calculated with blood Nihils.

⬥ XP per kill : 2,532.6 + 835.7

docs.title: Desirable drops
docs.text:
⬥ Summoning ingredient drops (Aviansie talons, Demon horn, Vampyre fangs, Icyene feather)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dropped from the Smoke, Shadow, Blood and Ice Nihils respectively.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Used to craft Nihil familiar pouches

​

⬥ They also have a very small chance to drop the , though one has a much better chance of obtaining this drop by killing Nex.

​

docs.title: Useful Items
docs.text: Items ⬥ Shard of Zaros     • Removes nihil aggression.     • This is absolutely essential if gathering souls or killing them individually. ⬥ Sixth-Age Circuit      • Allows for an easy teleport to the World Gate. ⬥ Grace of the Elves      • Highly useful as a swap to automatically bank nihil materials. ​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
Teleport to the World Gate with , set it to Freneskae and select the option "The Pit" to teleport to where Nihils are. Walking on the center tile will provide the option to spawn Nihils for slayer.

​

⬥ Alternatively, teleport to Eagles' Peak lodestone and run south to the World Gate.

​

docs.title: Method: Low effort Magic
docs.text:
Magic can utilise the terrain and Nihils' natural aggression to group them up, followed by barraging them down with . The use of tank armour and also helps it withstand the attacks of multiple Nihils.

​

docs.title: Preset
docs.text: Preset Suggestions ⬥ Low effort Magic

docs.title: Strategy
docs.text:
⬥ Spawn the Nihils and run around the pillars to group them up. Make sure to have less than 9 on you else will not hit all of them.

​

⬥ If done properly, this achieves ~500kph, getting around 70-100 Nihil pouch ingredients + ~5m in other commons (mostly from onyx bolts and herbs). Being on task helps but the short length of Nihil slayer tasks makes this method mostly impractical for XP.

​

docs.title: Method: AFK Magic [PoSD]
docs.text:
As players can place specific nihil variants in a dungeon, the best method of killing Nihils is AoEing blood Nihils in the player owned dungeon. This can be done with both revo++ or legacy.

​

⬥ Revo++ vs Legacy:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Legacy benefits: Tank armour not required.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Revo++ benefits: Significantly lower rune cost and higher kph (~120 more with a BIS setup).

​

⬥ If using legacy with , use , otherwise, use . Cast if using revo++

​

docs.title: Presets
docs.text:
Preset Suggestions ⬥ Active Magic (Soul Gathering) ⬥ AFK Magic (PoSD)

​

docs.title: Strategy - Gathering souls
docs.text:
⬥ As blood Nihils cannot be isolated from the other nihil variants, they must be fought in an active manner. Magic is suggested for this although it may also be viable to use ranged with sufficient accuracy boosts.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do NOT have multi-hitting abilities on your bar to avoid aggroing other Nihils. This includes

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• can be used as it does not aggro other Nihils.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee is not as viable as you will spend a lot of time chasing Nihils around due to their high mobility.

​

⬥ Stand in the western area of The Pit where the blood Nihils spawn.

​

⬥ Do not spend excessive amounts of time chasing the nihil. Target close-by Nihils as fast as possible after they spawn to prevent them from running away.

​

docs.title: Strategy - PoSD slaying
docs.text:
⬥ Place the Nihils in the small room. Stand in the middle of the room if using revo++.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stand in the northeast corner (yellow box) if using legacy.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
There are 4 Nodon dragonkin variants that can be killed for slayer: Nodon engineers, artificers, hunters, and guards. The Nodon dragonkin task can be assigned by Morvran or Laniakea and requires level 92 . Additionally, players can kill Kerapac in Normal Mode or Hard Mode, since the buffs (but not ) apply to the boss.

​

⬥ Currently there are only methods detailed for Nodon guards and artificers. If you have a different method for Nodon hunters or engineers, please make a post in #suggestions.

​

​

Note: Dragon cluster tasks from Laniakea apply and buffs to Slayer monsters at Nodon front but not . This also applies for , and Dragonbane weaponry.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rate are 3/2560 each from Nodon engineers and 5/64 each from Elite versions (Nodon enforcers).

docs.text:

⬥ Option 2: Enter a War's Retreat/Max Guild portal and run to the location from there (Fastest for Nodon Artificers).
