docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Slayer is a combat-based skill, where XP is awarded for killing the monsters assigned to you by a Slayer Master, with harder monsters generally giving more XP. Slayer is a great way for the player to earn GP and combat XP while progressing their account, and can be trained using both low-effort and high-effort methods.

​

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
⬥ Early Slayer Assignments offer low XP rates, which can be avoided with other methods, such as squashing Scarabs in Menaphos and completing Reaper tasks

⬥ Generally, using the highest levelled Slayer Master is recommended, with the exception of Mandrith who only offers Wilderness tasks.

⬥ Cluster assignments are highly valued as they allow you to fight monsters above your level for high XP rates, e.g. fighting Greater Demon Berserkers for a "Demons" task.

⬥ AFKing assignments sacrifices XP rates for convenience, actively Slaying will always grant the player higher XP rates.

⬥ ‎ ‎Most Slayer Masters have a chance of offering the player a unique assignment which they may accept or decline, these often give good reward for the effort needed to complete them.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Notable special assignments are Laniakea's, which is well worth the effort, Morvran's, which should be completed only once for the Completionist Cape, and the Raptor's, which is also involved in a Completionist Cape requirement.

​

docs.title: Utilizing Slayer Points
docs.text:
Slayer Points are obtained by successfully completing Slayer Assignments with the amount given depending on the Slayer Master used. If you ever find yourself wanting to quickly obtain Slayer Points, you can find our guide on farming them in #Slayer Point Farming Guide.

​

⬥ As for how to spend Slayer Points, our order of priority is:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Building a block/prefer list and upgrading your Slayer Helmet

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocking any desired Slayer Assignments, such as Nightmare Creatures.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quality of life unlocks such as quicker killing blows and attaching items to your Toolbelt.

​

docs.title: Managing Your Block/Prefer List
docs.text:
The Block & Prefer list is a very powerful tool which can be used to focus your Slaying on monsters that grant great reward, while ignoring those which the player deems a waste of time or not fun to slay. You can find our guide on finding the best block/prefer list for you in #Block Prefer List.

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
Preset Suggestions ⬥ Magic preset ⬥ Melee preset ⬥ Ranged preset ⬥ Necromancy preset

⬥ These presets and relics are examples of what the player may bring on their assignment.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Specific relic setups and aura usage are included in our monster guides, you can view our general recommendations with the !relics ‎and !aura ‎commands.

​

docs.title: Ability Usage
docs.text:
We have several guides on specific Slayer Assignments with their own methods and action bar layouts, you can find them in #rs3-slayer.

​

⬥ ‎ ‎Generally, AoE abilities will be prioritized when training Slayer, below are examples of AoE abilities for each combat style.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Magic : Chain or Greater Chain , Corruption Blast , Dragon Breath , Tsunami , ‎ ‎and Magma Tempest

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Melee : Cleave , Bladed Dive , Quake , Hurricane , and Meteor Strike

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Ranged : Ricochet or Greater Ricochet , Corruption Shot , and Bombardment

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Mechanised Chinchompa can be used to make many single target abilities hit in a 3x3 AoE.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Necromancy : Soul Strike , Blood Siphon , Spectral Scythe , Death Skulls and Threads of Fate + any single target ability.

⬥ ‎ ‎Tuska's Wrath deals extra damage against your current Slayer Assignment at an increased cooldown.

​

docs.title: Useful Items
docs.text:
⬥ Slayer Helmet     • BiS helm against current assignment.     • At 90 Slayer, prioritize building the Slayer Helmet stand on Anachronia so you don't have to wear it. ⬥ Slayer VIP Tickets     • Lets you choose between 2 assignments. ⬥ Wilder Pie     • Boosts your Slayer level by 6 for 6 minutes. ⬥ Cannons / / /     • Deals AoE damage and draws aggro, Artisans' Workshop upgrade allows for automatic reloading. ⬥ Demon Horn Necklace     • Restores prayer if paired with Bonecrusher (for bones) or Attuned Ectoplasmator (for ashes). ⬥ Scrimshaw of Sacrifice      • Destroys loot for increased XP. Uniques destroyed count towards logs. ⬥ Ushabti     • Captures monster souls used in the Sunken Pyramid and the Slayer Codex ⬥ Slayer's Introspection     • Lets you choose minimum or maximum possible size task. ⬥ Drop Cleaners     • Several items can help collect or consume drops automatically, such as Spring Cleaner , Magic Notepaper , and Artificer's Measure.     • Your toolbelt can hold several other drop cleaning items. ⬥ Teleports     • There are many useful teleports, such as the Slayer Cape and the Slayer Codex

​

docs.title: Perks
docs.text:
⬥ Genocidal     • Grants a damage boost against the current Slayer target, increasing as the task progresses. ⬥ X-Slayer Perks / /     • Grants a damage bonus to the perk's respective monster type. ⬥ Scavenging     • Grants Invention components when killing monsters. These stack up quickly. ⬥ Caroming     • Allows Chain , Ricochet , and their greater variants to hit more targets.

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Revenants are a popular type of Wilderness monster which may be found in the Forinthry Dungeon. They're mainly killed for the Chaos Elemental collection log, Wilderness collection log, and the Revenant Spirit which is used to unlock the Revenant pet as well as its skins; this drop gets increasingly rarer the more skins you have.

​

⬥ After the Wilderness update killing revenants became substantially safer, as players can now opt-out of PvP.

⬥ Using a Forinthry bracelet will make revenants NOT be aggressive.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This effect will persist for an hour and only count down while in the Forinthry Dungeon.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Even if it was used years ago, the effect may still be active.

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When going from knight to dragon, kill 3-5 revenants. When going from dragon to knight, kill 2-3 revenants.

⬥ Blue and yellow: Potential detour routes for red and green routes respectively depending on revenant movement.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Ripper Demons are one of the 4 Raptor specialty monsters, as such they boast mechanics that make engaging them more dangerous than normal mobs. They are mainly killed for Slayer tasks, the Kharidian Desert collection log, the parasitic orb which is used to unlock the Nipper demon pet, and for profit via creating

​

⬥ Ripper Demons can be assigned as a Slayer assignment by Mandrith, Laniakea, Morvran, Kuradal, and The Raptor.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Demon cluster tasks also work, they may be assigned by Laniakea, and The Raptor.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ Laniakea assigns almost twice as many.

⬥ This guide will focus on killing Ripper Demons via AOE methods as they yield the highest KPH; however, at lower levels it is suggested to kill them one at time in the Ripper Demon cave southeast of the Al Kharid lodestone

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bring your best Melee gear with , , and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Midday skybox helps brighten the area.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ level: 96

⬥ XP per kill: 2,721.6

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~930 (Low Effort), ~1700 (Low Effort)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour: ~2.53M (Low Effort), ~3.79M (Low Effort)

​

docs.title: Mechanics
docs.text:
Slaughter ⬥ When engaged from a distance, Ripper Demons will immediately teleport to the player and cast Slaughter , which deals triple damage if you move.     • This makes them extremely easy to stack up for AoE damage.     • This also incentivises staying at the same spot when AoEing. Death from above ⬥ Ripper Demons gain adrenaline whenever they autoattack.     • When the bar fills up, they will jump and land where the player was standing shortly after, dealing up to 32,000 hard typeless damage resulting in an instant kill.     • This can be avoided by moving away from your original location immediately upon seeing them jump.     • When AoEing, good DPM is crucial to avoid this mechanic. Aggression ⬥ If the player is below 35% HP, all nearby Ripper Demons will immediately aggro to the player.     • Usually, using when low HP is desirable to prevent being stacked out. Death spin ⬥ When killed, Ripper Demons will spin and hit any nearby players with weak rapid melee hits per tick in a 3x3 area, which can deal large damage if stood in.     • This mechanic is the main reason and are essential for killing rippers.

​

docs.text:
⬥ Ripper claw and Off-hand ripper claw

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 times rarer off-task.

⬥ Parasitic orb

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Significantly more common from Slasher Demons (elite variant).

⬥ Raptor key part 2

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Must be on task.

⬥ Miner's journal 1-5 and The Diary of Jebediah Omnis

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for

⬥ Cursed amascut sand

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dropped by any of the 4 Raptor specialty monsters.

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text:
Owning the following increases the efficiency of your sessions, but is by no means mandatory. Items ⬥ Binding contracts and Magic notepaper     • Increases profit via creating ⬥ Armour perked with Demon Slayer     • +7% damage against demons. ⬥ Armour perked with Enhanced Devoted     • Reduces incoming damage when active. ⬥ Oldak coil     • Make sure to have the Restocking Cannon ability unlocked. Other ⬥ Demon Slayer (ability)     • Increases damage against demons by 15% for 10 seconds.     • 1-minute cooldown. ⬥ Infernal Puzzle Box (tier 6)     • 14% damage reduction and 9% damage increase whilst in the Wilderness.         ⬩ This effect scales with the tier of your puzzle box.     • Tier 6 allows you to put it in your tool belt.

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get there
docs.text:
The Wilderness

If killing Ripper Demons in the Wilderness; they are located west of the Demonic Ruins / northeast of Red Dragon Isle, they are aggressive in this location. Ensure you disable PVP by speaking to Vala in Edgeville.

​

1) How to get there in order of speed:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a) Annakarl Teleport (Ancient Magicks) and run west, has a high chance of aggro'ing Kal'gerion demons

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b) Games necklace teleport to Corporeal Beast and run northeast.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎c) Wilderness sword teleport to herb patch and run north, then east along the lava.

​

Notes:

⬥ Click here to open a map of optimal routes for the above.

⬥ If hunting elite spawns in the Wilderness, stay a few kills after the end of your task in case the "forced spawn" is delayed.

​

⬥ Unless otherwise specified, stand in-between the lava pools to funnel the onto one tile.

​

Ripper Demon Cave

If killing Ripper Demons in the Ripper Demon cave; teleport to the Al Kharid lodestone and run southeast towards the cave entrance. They are not aggressive in this location.

​

​

docs.title: Method: Low Effort Magic
docs.text:
Magic is very effective at damage reduction and as such is a strong choice for killing Ripper Demons. Stacking Animate Dead , Cryptbloom armour , Infernal Puzzle Box , Deflect Melee with Amulet of souls and Enhanced Devoted 4 , should allow players to sustain themselves purely with Blood Barrage healing alone.

​

Walk up and attack demons between steps. This is the most dangerous part of the method as the first few demons are the slowest to kill since is not active yet and you have no stacks. Keep track of the demons on you and look out for jumps (refer to example video below).

​

⬥ Ensure Legacy Combat Mode is active.

⬥ Pray and or

⬥ Sustain with or

⬥ Autocast and upkeep

⬥ Ensure and are active at all times.

⬥ Activate

⬥ Drink once you are comfortably set up with active.

​

Notes:

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Shattered Worlds is a combat-based minigame where it's reward currency, Shattered Anima, is awarded for killing mobs and achieving objectives in the minigame. This currency can be used to purchase a variety of abilities, titles, pets, slayer masks and notably, Huge Slayer XP Lamps. At level 120 this gives 103,132 Slayer experience, at the cost of 6 million Anima. This guide will go over the most efficient method of farming Anima to purchase these lamps, to achieve high Slayer XP rates.

​

Note: This method also gives high XP, but is not recommended as the main way to train slayer once the player is at a higher level, due to offering nothing but slayer XP.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ World Set: 101-105

⬥ Optimal Anima Rate: 170m/h

⬥ Optimal XP Rate: ~1.9m/h

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get There
docs.text:
The Shattered Worlds minigame is located in the south of the Lumbridge Swamp, easily accessible via the Lumbridge lodestone and running south west. Direct teleports can be bought from the reward shop, but are not recommended to be used.

​

docs.title: Useful Items
docs.text:
⬥ Acceleration Powerburst - Reduces the cooldown of mobility abilities such as Bladed Dive , Surge and Escape to 0.6s, allowing for extremely quick travel over large distances.

​

⬥ Essence of Finality Amulet with Dark Bow spec - Required for optimal rates, allows for huge AoE damage to be dealt in conjunction with Mechanised Chinchompas .

​

docs.title: Method
docs.text:
⬥ The best worlds to farm are 101-105, due to them starting with the Feeling Pumped modifier, and having low HP mobs.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Feeling Pumped gives the player unlimited adrenaline for 10s upon activation, which allows the player to deal massive damage in a short time, and is required for this style of farming.

​

⬥ Shattered worlds has 3 main objectives, kill X amount of enemies, deal X amount of damage, or repair the portal. Completing an objective quickly rewards the player with skipping worlds in that bracket, up to 3 worlds skipped if the first world is completed in under 1 minute.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To farm anima efficiently, skipping worlds is the priority. However, due to RNG in the objectives, skipping 2 worlds is often more achievable.

​

⬥ Ranged offers the most efficient way to farm these worlds, via the usage of the Dark bow special attack , stored in an Essence of Finality necklace to allow it to be used with Mechanical chinchompas , allowing the player to often one-hit large groups of enemies. If Feeling Pumped has not activated yet, simply use basic abilities or thresholds like Snapshot . An example video is shown below featuring various world skips.

​

Note: Melee can also be viable, having strong AoE potential with abilities such as (, , , , ), however will be significantly slower than ranged.

​

⬥ As speed is the most important factor here, Acceleration potions can be particularly helpful for clearing large distances, to get to more enemies or to rush to the portal after finishing an objective. If getting to the portal quicker will help with world skips, use it, otherwise save it for the next world where it may come in more useful, this is up to the player's discretion.

​

⬥ The usage of Target Cycling is heavily recommended. This is due to auto-attacks stalling repeated Essence of Finality special attacks , preventing you from continuously speccing whilst Feeling Pumped is active. Targets can still be clicked if the player is careful not to auto-attack.

​

⬥ Soulsplit is used for all healing, as the massive damage dealt generates a lot of healing, but if more healing is required, the Vampyrism aura can be used. Solid food is also recommended, as adrenaline is effectively infinite, alongside healing a large amount in one bite and therefore has no downside.

​

⬥ The best modifiers to take after Feeling pumped are variable, but generally consistent. Electric, Explosive (if not using ) and Charged. However, with an objective like kill X mobs, a negative modifier like Hydra can be positive.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In the case of no positive modifiers, options like Zombie Apocalypse, Zone of Suffering or Hungry are the least negative options and can be ignored.

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
⬥ Slayer Points are a currency obtained by completing Slayer Assignments which have several uses, such as skipping Slayer Assignments, purchasing consumables such as , and purchasing permanent unlocks at Slayer Masters.

⬥ This mini-guide will outline a method of effectively farming these points without having to complete lengthy, high leveled Slayer Assignments.

​

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
⬥ Access to lunar spellbook: Spellbook swap (Lunar) + NPC Contact

⬥ Completion of The Blood Pact quest for access to the Lumbridge Catacombs.

⬥ You may optionally use Slayer Introspection to guarantee the shortest assignments possible.

​

Blocklist

⬥ Copy the blocklist below to ensure that all Slayer Assignments given by Jacquelyn will be to slay monsters present in the Lumbridge Catacombs.

Jacquelyn Blocklist ⬥ Cave Bugs ⬥ Cows ⬥ Cave Slimes ⬥ Frogs ⬥ Birds ⬥ Ghosts ⬥ Rats ⬥ Spiders

​

docs.title: Presets and Relics
docs.text:
Preset Suggestions ⬥ Low-level Magic camp ⬥ High-level Hybrid

​

docs.title: The Method
docs.text:
⬥ This method consists of doing 9 Slayer Assignments with Jacquelyn , then doing the 10th with Laniakea or your current highest level Slayer Master (not including Mandrith ).

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This takes advantage of the Slayer Point bonus awarded to the player after every 10th and 50th assignment completion while also letting us speed past assignments 1-9 with Jacquelyn's short and easy tasks.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Raptor may also be used as they reward a good amount of Slayer Points while also having generally quicker assignments.

⬥ Before starting, ensure you are not currently on a Slayer streak that ends with a 9 by clicking on the Slayer icon located on the Slayer counter.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This can be enabled in Settings > Gameplay > Interfaces > Information Windows > Slayer counter.

​

1) Enter the bottom floor of the Lumbridge Catacombs and stand in the Skeleton room.

​

2) Use Spellbook swap (Lunar) and then NPC Contact to receive a Slayer Assignment from Jacquelyn (located at the bottom right of the interface).

​

3) Slay the required monsters within the catacombs, all possible assignments can be completed in the southern half of the dungeon.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎a) With the high-level preset alternate between and

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎b) If Magic camping prioritise AoE Magic spells such as Corruption Blast , Greater Chain , and Magma Tempest

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎c) The Goblin used for this method, Skoblin, also count toward Skeleton assignments.

​

4) Repeat steps 2 & 3 until your streak ends in 9, which can be confirmed by either having the slayer counter expanded or double checking the message in chat that's received by the player after completing an assignment.

​

5) Spellbook swap (Lunar) + NPC Contact again, this time receiving an assignment from your highest leveled Slayer Master (or the Raptor for faster tasks). Upon completion you'll be rewarded the bulk of the Slayer Points from this method and can repeat from step 1.

​

docs.text:
There are 6 types of soul devourers, ranging from 105 to 117 Slayer . The Magister may also be killed for this task, requiring 115 Slayer . The mobs each require a different level of attention, and the profits differ.

⬥ The Magister will give 8000 Slayer experience per kill and benefit from the use of Tuska's Wrath , but the slayer helmet effect does not work on him.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

⬥ Vital Spark

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can be doubled via the use of vital spark drop enhancers.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Required for the Slayer collection log.

⬥ Soul devourers each have their own drop tables, containing good alchables and other resources, making them a consistent moneymaker.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Sophanem Slayer Dungeon contains chests which will automatically gather drops.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can teleport there with Sophanem Slayer Dungeon teleport tablets.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively, you can teleport to the Menaphos lodestone , take the bridge to Sophanem, and then run south to the dungeon entrance.

⬥ Sunken Pyramid (south-eastern room, 5 spawns)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In the small room, position yourself anywhere near the center of all the spawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ For Imperial warrior akh's stand in the northern part of the room and target southern spawns.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can teleport there with a teleport to house tablet, or with a Slayer Codex

Items ⬥ Slayer Codex     • Once 50 souls are added, it can be used to teleport to the Sunken Pyramid. ⬥ Sophanem Slayer Dungeon teleport     • Allows quick access to the Sophanem Slayer Dungeon. ⬥ Feather of Ma'at     • Required for killing mobs inside the Sophanem Slayer Dungeon. ⬥ Vital spark drop enhancer     • Gives an additional vital spark if gotten as a drop.     • Can be purchased for 1000 Dungeoneering tokens ⬥ Sophanem slayer dungeon drop enhancers     • Increases chance to get Key to the Crossing drops.     • Can be purchased for 10,000 Dungeoneering tokens Other ⬥ Vampyrism aura     • Provides extra healing for the higher damaging mobs. ⬥ Inspiration aura     • Provides extra adrenaline for the Necromancy methods.

docs.text:
Four Tormented Demon souls should be placed into a large room in the Sunken Pyramid, use Necromancy with a blood reaver familiar and weapon poison.

​

⬥ Pray and /

⬥ Sustain with +

⬥ Ensure , and are active at all times

⬥ You do not need as the demons are naturally aggressive

⬥ Do not use Darkness

​

docs.title: Location and How to Get there
docs.text:
⬥ Sunken Pyramid (either northern room, 4 spawns)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In either large room, position yourself anywhere near the center of all the spawns

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can teleport there with a teleport to house tablet, or with a Slayer Codex

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
TzHaar creatures are killed for the Ring of Stone drop, which is their rarest item for the Karamja slayer log. This method utilises legacy combat mode. The method is basically just running around the TzHaar City and killing every TzHaar monster you see. If you happen to get the Ring of Stone early, the Fight Cauldron minigame is your best way of obtaining the rest of the items you're missing.

​

docs.title: Notable drops
docs.text:
⬥ Ring of stone 1/5000 or 1/4850 with /

⬥ Various Tzhaar weapons/armour

​

docs.title: Recommended items
docs.text:
⬥ Replace with

⬥ Any DPS aura, such as / /

⬥ Weapon preference: Decimation > Upgraded bone blowpipe > Seren godbow > Noxious longbow + with Araxyte arrows

⬥ Any decent DPS armour / /

​

docs.text:

docs.title: Overview of the Fight Cauldron
docs.text:
Fight Cauldron is a safe minigame unlocked after the Grandmaster quest The Brink of Extinction. Within the Fight Cauldron minigame, players battle with unlimited waves of TokHaar monsters who wish to test their might, and that of their opponent.

​

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will need a total of 228 obsidian shards to make every piece of obsidian equipment. On average, this will take 66 kills in the Cauldron.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Full Obsidian armour is required for the TokHaar-Mok achievement.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fight Cauldron is also the fastest way to obtain weapon/armour drops for the Karamja slayer log.

​

docs.title: Minimal requirements
docs.text:
⬥ 80 +

⬥ Any T85 Weapon or better

⬥ A hybrid armour set (lower levels only)

​

docs.title: Ranged preset
docs.text:
​

⬥ with Araxyte arrows

***NOTE: If are owned, use those instead of kiln capes. ***

​

docs.title: Mechanics to watch for
docs.text:
⬥ Hot floor sections

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Keep an eye on the floor. Standing on a hot section of the floor will deal damage equal to 20% of your life points every game tick, which can kill you quickly.

​

docs.title: IMPORTANT: If you are about to die, simply leave the fight. If you die, the shard amount that you would get normally rewarded with is halved.
Video Guide made by Trinijunie
docs.text:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21x5kr6_2Xc

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
⬥ the Ultimate Slayer is a title obtained by completing every slayer collection log item. After the wilderness update, it became a popular goal for many players as PvP can now be turned off. This guide contains all the tips and tricks to make the grind as smooth as possible.

This made tasks like Lava Strykewyrms, Revenants and Ripper demons a very safe and hassle-free task.

⬥ An overview of generally helpful slayer items/consumables/auras/relics can be found in #Overview of Slayer

⬥ Task specific guides can be found in #rs3-slayer

​

docs.title: Useful Items
docs.text:
Useful Items Items that will greatly assist the player's Ultimate Slayer journey. Consumables - Time savers ⬥ Fellstalk incense sticks     • Each potency level provides a x1.01 multiplier to elite NPCs spawn chance, up to ~4% (tiers stack multiplicatively).     • Important item for tasks such as: Ripper Demons, Edimmu and Rune Dragons. ⬥ Slayer VIP ticket     • Usually obtained via the Travelling Merchant or Cabbage Facepunch Bonanza.     • You can also kill the beginner version of the Giant Mimic for ~30+ slayer VIP tickets per hour depending on luck. ⬥ Seeker's Charm     • Offering them to the northern portal in the stalker dungeon increases the chance of elite soulgazers appearing from 1/50 to 1/10. ​ Consumables - QoL ⬥ Lantadyme incense sticks     • Extends potion timers up to +2 minutes at max potency - reduces the doses of used. ⬥ Potion reservoir     • Allows for potions with a timer to be automatically consumed - Helps the grind become more AFK. ⬥ Penance powder     • Good alternative to for upkeep. ​ Other Untradeable items ⬥ Most wanted cards     • Obtained weekly from the platinum mode of Rush of Blood.     • Increases unique droprates for their respective monsters.     • Each card contains 100 charges, each kill of the monsters depletes 1 charge.     • Multiple copies cannot be obtained.     • Very good for Glacors and Automatons ⬥ Slayer Masks     • Allow players to force a task for the monster once a day. Read more in the following section.

​

docs.title: Daily Slayer mask tasks
docs.text:
⬥ There are 2 main reasons to force 1 task per day with their respective slayer masks:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Easy points that adds up over time.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Removes the need to use lower tier slayer masters.

​

⬥ Most important: Use slayer masks for monsters whose uniques are only obtainable on-task/have rates significantly boosted on task:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ice strykewyrm - Staff of light

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Desert strykewyrm - Focus sight

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Jungle strykewyrm - Hexcrest

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Airut - Razorback gauntlets (Only on task)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Abyssal demon - Abyssal wand and orb (Only on task)

​

Note: Other slayer masks such as Mask of Kurask/Basilisks/Stone provide a boost in drop chance for their respective head items.

​

docs.title: Task prioritisation
docs.text:
**Disclaimer! This section assumes the following:

⬥ You own the Slayer master cape

⬥ Laniakea is your main slayer master

⬥ You are starting with mostly empty logs

⬥ Block/Prefer lists are based on task weighing and general level of annoyance of the task**

​

The Slayer master cape has a perk that gives a 20% chance to choose what a new task will be from a Slayer master. There are a couple of tasks that should have priority over others. The last thing you want is having little to no points with your last item being an Edimmu pet which can be very hard to obtain.

​

Block and Prefer Tasks Ask questions if you get stumped Prefer List • Ripper demons • Demons cluster • Strykewyrms cluster • Lava Strykewyrms • Dragons cluster • Gemstone dragons • Dinosaurs • Edimmu (see below) Block List • Black demons • Elves • Greater Demons • Dark beasts (after dark bow is obtained) • Aviansies • Gargoyles (after granite maul is obtained) • Vyrewatch • Crystal Shapeshifters (after elven ring is obtained)

​

Note: Undead cluster and Creatures of Daemonheim are also good prefer tasks to replace any monsters you finish before obtaining the pet.

​

Priority (P) list if your cape procs:

​

⬥ P1: Edimmu

⬥ P2: Ripper demons , Demons cluster task

⬥ P3: Camel Warrior , Living Wyverns , Lava Strykewyrms , Strykewyrms cluster, Dinosaurs

⬥ P4: Nightmare creatures , Creatures of the Lost Grove

⬥ P5: Ascension creatures , Celestial Dragons

⬥ P6: Dragon cluster, Gemstone dragons

⬥ P7: Anything that can be killed without a task and does not provide a drop boost on task (Stalker creatures, Kal'gerion demons, Tormented demons, Aquanites, Nihils, Glacors, Nodon Dragonkin...)

​

Note: Tasks that can be toggled with slayer points should be turned off after obtaining their relevant drops.

​

docs.title: Wilderness tasks
docs.text:
By doing tasks in the wilderness whenever feasible, you can obtain more for future revenant tasks.

​

Tasks that should be done in the wilderness during Ultimate Slayer:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ripper demons

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lava Strykewyrms

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Abyssal Creatures

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hydrix Dragons (optional)

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Vyres are a popular mob type to camp due to their rewarding loot table, and the generous amount of experience awarded upon killing them. The preferred variants to kill are Vyrelords and Vyreladys, which can be found in Darkmeyer. Upon unlocking the Sunspear, vyre corpses can be automatically cremated upon killing them; making them a very cheap way of training Prayer and Firemaking , whilst doing very low-input combat training.

​

⬥ Darkmeyer is unlocked after partial completion of The Branches of Darkmeyer quest; however, the reforged Sunspear is acquired during the River of Blood quest.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Completing the Morytania elite achievements is recommended due to the worn effect of the Morytania legs 4.

​

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
⬥ XP per kill: 343.6

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• XP per kill: 280 (420 with Morytania legs 4)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• XP per kill: 200 (300 with Morytania legs 4)

⬥ Optimal kills per hour: ~1040 , ~1020 (Flagpole), ~900 (Flagpole) (All AFK)

⬥ Optimal XP per hour: ~357k , ~350k (Flagpole), ~309k (Flagpole) (All AFK)

​

docs.title: Desirable drops
docs.text:
⬥ Vyres have a very rewarding loot table, filled with Herblore supplies, seeds, and alchables; particularly useful in Ironman mode

⬥ Cremating 200 and 500 vyre corpses is required for the Shade-Shattering Ka-Bloom and Ivan is Flailing achievements respectively.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every 50 vyre corpses cremated gives you +10 damage with all Sunspear variants , capping out at 500 vyre corpses cremated (+100 damage).

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cremating 500 vyre corpses is a requirement for the master quest cape and the trimmed completionist cape

​

docs.title: Useful Items and Unlocks
docs.text:
Owning the following increases the efficiency of your sessions, but is by no means mandatory. Items ⬥ Reforged Sunspear (tier 78)     • +75% hit chance.     • Automatically cremate vyre corpses upon killing them.     • The standard Sunspear (tier 75) also has the aforementioned effects, but it can't be augmented. ⬥ Morytania legs 4     • 50% more Prayer and Firemaking experience from vyre corpses. ⬥ Drop cleaners     • Notable ones include: charming imp, spirit gem bag, advanced gold accumulator, spring cleaner, seedicide, seed bag, gem bag and magic notepaper. Other ⬥ Ivan is Flailing     • Cremating 500 vyre corpses grants you a +100 damage bonus. ⬥ Penance and all prayer boosting auras     • Cycle between Penance, Greater salvation, Greater harmony, and Greater corruption.         ⬩ If not using a form of prayer renewal, you may need the tier 3 variants.     • This allows you to save money on vis wax and powder of penance ⬥ Flame gloves and Ring of fire     • Passive increases Firemaking experience by 5%.     • Check the Skilling Sheet to see if you should use them.         ⬩ Do NOT request edit permissions! File → Make a copy.

​

Before starting your session, make sure to fix the spawns on the world you're using, and set up the flagpole lure if using or , this will increase your kph but doesn't work with . Refer to this video to learn how to fix spawns and set up the flagpole lure.

⬥ Activating Wen book adds 2-3% kph.

Note: on server reset Vanescula Drakan will block the path for vyres trying to walk to you. This is fixed by talking to Vanescula and then walking under her.

docs.title: General Armour Introduction
docs.text:
⬥ There are three categories of armour:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Power: any armour with a style bonus

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hybrid: anything stated as "hybrid"

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tank: any other item (also has more armour than power / hybrid)

⬥ Armour tiers are based on the level required to equip them

⬥ Equipping armour provides style and armour bonuses

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These bonuses are based on armour category and tier

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally armours in the same category and tier will have equal bonuses

⬥ Wearing off-style armour slots (excluding cape slot) provides an accuracy penalty based on armour bonus

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• "Off-style" is any style that does not match your equipped main hand / 2H weapon

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hybrid gear incurs no penalty

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This penalty is near-doubled (0.8→1.5) when using the Necromancy combat style.

⬥ Some armour sets have set effects which may be useful

​

Index of Armour ⬥ It is recommended to look up further information on the Wiki ⬥ Armour in bold is worth being aware of, they will be elaborated on after or are recommended in the respective upgrade order ⬥ Use !armour to see DPS difference between the armour ⬥ Generally speaking, use power armour Power Armour ⬥ GWD1 Armour (T70) ⬥ Ancient Warrior (T78)     • Superior is T88 ⬥ Nex Armour (T80) ⬥ Anima Armour (T80)     • Refined is T85 ⬥ Elite Robinhood (T82) ⬥ Tectonic (T90)     • Elite is T92 ⬥ Sirenic (T90)     • Elite is T92 ⬥ Dracolich (T90)     • Elite is T92 ⬥ Masterwork (T90)     • Trimmed is T92 ⬥ Malevolent (T90) ⬥ Vestments of Havoc (T95) Tank Armour ⬥ Barrows Armour (T70) ⬥ Deathwarden (T70, T80, T90) ⬥ Ganodermic (T75) ⬥ Ports (T85)     • Superior is augmentable ⬥ Achto (T90) ⬥ Cryptbloom (T90) Power Armour ⬥ Deathdealer (T70, T80, T90) ⬥ The First Necromancer's equipment (T95)

docs.title: Notable Armour
docs.text:
⬥ (Vestments of Havoc) has effects that greatly benefit melee. Should be used over . Does T100 damage and has armour equal to T75 power armour

⬥ (Sirenic) is solid cheap ranged power armour

⬥ (Elite Dracolich) is very strong ranged power armour when used with a bow

⬥ (Ganodermic) is very cheap magic tank gear to use with Animate Dead

⬥ ‎ ‎(Cryptbloom) is the best overall tank armour in game, but not always needed - see !crypt​

⬥ (The First Necromancer's equipment) is the best overall Necromancy armour in the game

​

docs.title: Gloves
docs.text:
Gloves ⬥ Use !gloves to see where to use which gloves ⬥ upgrades / / to T90 and allows enchantments to work     • The T90 gloves can also be bought directly from the G.E. ⬥ Gloves covered: | | | | | | Kerapac's Wrist Wraps ⬥ When is cast, the next to hit within 6s has all its remaining hits applied at once for 25% (40% with enchantment of flame) more damage Elite Dracolich Gloves ⬥ Adds to the passive effects from the armour set     • Elite Dracolich Remnant per piece gain 0.5% extra adrenaline for each hit of Rapid fire     • Dracolich infusion at 3 pieces, after a full gain +40% critical strike chance with for 3 seconds, +1.8 seconds for every additional piece Nightmare Gauntlets ⬥ has +25% hitchance and can be walked ⬥ Enchantment of dread makes to do a 2nd weaker hit when flanking Gloves of Passage ⬥ After / are cast the following occurs (same target):     • The next attack deals 10% (16% using agony enchantment) more damage         ⬩ Affects non-bleed attacks cast that tick, bleeds snipe it for no benefit     • Bleeds deal 20% (25% using agony enchantment) more damage for 10s         ⬩ Does not affect / / / "bleeds" as they are not bleeds Misc. Gloves ⬥ Cinderbanes - increases poison damage, and can proc own poison hits ⬥ Deathtouched Bracelet - 20% chance to reflect 25-50% damage (7.5% average reflect) back to the attacker (does not reduce damage you take) ⬥ Spellcaster's Gloves - autos / basics have 5% chance to do 25% more damage, bind target, lower their combat stats by 7 levels and hit 1t after cast     • Does not work during /

docs.title: General Weapons Introduction
docs.text:
⬥ The tier of a weapon is the listed equip requirement. Generally the damage and accuracy tier match that

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Exceptions include: (T90 damage, T75 accuracy), GWD2 weapons (T80 damage, T90 accuracy), and (T88 damage, T85 accuracy)

⬥ For dual-wield weapons:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Overall damage tier is equal to 66% of the main hand's tier and 33% of the off-hand's tier

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Overall accuracy tier you have is equal to your main hand's tier fully.

⬥ For ammo'd weapons and weapons:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage tier is equal to the minimum between the weapon tier and the ammo / spell tier

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎⬩ E.g. a T90 weapon with a T1 ammo / spell has T1 damage

​

docs.title: Defenders and Shields
docs.text:
Defenders and Shields ⬥ It is recommended to look up further information on the Wiki ⬥ Use !defender for info on obtaining defenders ⬥ Defender weapon and shield tier is half its tier (e.g. T90 defender is T45) ⬥ Defenders provide 3% accuracy and 1/15 chance to reduce hit by 50-100% ⬥ T90 shields' right-click voke option drops target when using queueing ⬥ Spirit shields reduce damage by 30%, 20% of it is removed from prayer ⬥ Shieldbows count as a MH + shield of its tier (e.g. is a T70 MH + shield) ⬥ Bone shield / is unlocked via and allows the use of defensive shield abilities without a physical shield, costing necrotic runes.     • With lvl120 , and you can reach up to bone shield tier 75. T90 Shields ⬥ Merciless () ⬥ Vengeful () ⬥ Malevolent () Spirit Shields (T75) ⬥ Arcane () ⬥ Elysian () ⬥ Divine () ⬥ Spectral () Defenders ⬥ Corrupted (T70) ⬥ Ancient (T80) ⬥ Kalphite (T90) Shieldbows ⬥ Darkbow (T70) ⬥ Strykebow (T85) Generally When to use What ⬥ Bone shield and work for most scenarios where a very high shield tier is unimportant     • Defenders when needing to do offensive shield abilities (e.g. ), but are effectively superseded by ⬥ Spirit Shields when needing to use effect to tank large hits ⬥ Shieldbows when using a bow ⬥ T90 shields otherwise (e.g. for bigger or very long )

​

docs.title: Rings
docs.text:
Rings ⬥ Use !ring to see when to use what ring ⬥ Rings covered: | | | | | | | | ⬥ + can be imbued for +2.5 style bonus at the Armoursmith for teci Ring of Death ⬥ On target death, 50% chance to gain 1% adren per 1.5k hp of it (caps at 5%) ⬥ On player death, the player is revived at full health and a damage-over-time effect is applied for three minutes ⬥ Overchargeable at Death for 5 cut onyx and 25 (has 5x charges) Channeler's Ring ⬥ Each hit of a channel has (4 * channel hits done)% more crit chance ⬥ Metaphysics enchantment causes +(2.5 * channel hits done) % crit dmg ⬥ To clarify: and its enchantment only affect channels, not autos, etc. Champion's Ring ⬥ attacks gain 3% (4% if heroism enchantment) crit chance if target bled ⬥ Heroism enchantment also adds (1.5 * bleed count)% crit damage Stalker's Ring ⬥ Bow attacks gain 3% (4% if shadow enchantment) crit chance ⬥ Shadow enchantment also adds 3% crit damage Occultist's ring ⬥ On cast, Necromancy attacks have a 10% chance to generate +2 stacks of Necrosis     • This does not affect conjure attacks or Bloat after the first hit Zorgoth's soul ring ⬥ Upgraded from Zorgoth's ring (quest reward from Requiem for a Dragon) while wearing it during rituals at the Ungael ritual site. ⬥ Necromancy hits have a 5% chance to generate +1 stack of Residual Soul     • This does not affect conjure attacks or Bloat after the first hit     • AOE abilities like Blood Siphon can proc for every target and every hit Other Rings ⬥ Reaver's Ring - +5% crit chance but -5% hitchance ⬥ Asylum Surgeon's Ring - 30s cooldown if either occur:     • 10% chance to prevent threshold cost     • 40% chance to save 25% of spec cost ⬥ Ring of Vigour - Ultimates refund 10% adren, spec cost reduced by 10%; this can be made passive via the Extinction quest

​

docs.title: Solid Food
docs.text:
Solid Food ⬥ All solid food drain 10% adrenaline when eaten while attacking ⬥ Use !food to see why solid foods are not great, and the alternatives List of Notable Solids ⬥ Sailfish - Heals 2.4K LP, can overheal up to 10% of max LP ⬥ Sailfish Soup - Heals 2.6K LP, can overheal up to 15% of max LP ⬥ Great Gunkan - Heals 2.85K LP over 10.8s     • Cannot eat another during this time ⬥ Primal Feast - Requires 115 , unpacks 4 items each healing 2.5K LP     • Requires 3 open inventory slots to unpack     • is untradeable, but ingredients are tradeable ⬥ Calorie Bomb - Heals equivalent of the 5 stored fish, user heals +20%     • Heals up to 4 other players within 2 squares of user

​

docs.text:

docs.title: Adrenaline Potions
docs.text: Adrenaline Potions ⬥ Cannot boost to make adrenaline potions ⬥ All have a 2min cooldown on adren generation effect  List of Notable Adrenaline Potions ⬥ Adrenaline Potion , 84  - Generates 25% adrenaline ⬥ Adrenaline Renewal Potion , 115  (cheaper at 119 )     • Can request assistance to make     • Generates 4% adrenaline per tick for 10 ticks (40% total)          - Excluding sip tick, you cannot use the 4% gained until the next tick     • Made using

docs.title: Bombs
docs.text:
Bombs ⬥ Bombs apply their effects 3t (1.8s) after being thrown ⬥ Bombs have a cast range of 9 tiles and spread over a 3x3 area Ways to Throw Bombs 1) Option 1: Default Action Bar Mode - Throws at target     • Does not show quantity on action bar 2) Option 2: Targeted Action Bar Mode - Throws at selected tile     • This allows for pre-bombing     • Shows quantity on action bar 3) Click from inventory - Throws at target List of Notable Bombs ⬥ Vulnerability Bomb - applies (10% damage increase)     • Casts 3 times, once every 0.6s     • Hitchance is equal to current accuracy against target ⬥ Sticky Bomb - binds monsters standing in it (lasts 6s)

​

docs.title: Incense Sticks
docs.text:
Incense Sticks ⬥ Refer to specific boss guides to see stick usage ⬥ Each stick increases buff duration by 10min, capping at 60 minutes ⬥ Potency has 4 ranks, increasing by 1 every 10min (maxes out after 30min)     • Use 6 sticks to 'overload' and start at rank 4 potency (starts at 10min) ⬥ Any form of death results in losing your incense buffs     • An upgrade purchaseable from Sydekix's Shop of Balance prevents this ⬥ At 95 you can have 3 incense effects active at once Notable Incense Sticks ⬥ Spirit Weed - (10 * potency)% increased spec attack recovery rate ⬥ Kwuarm - Deal +(2.5 * potency)% poison damage ⬥ Irit - (25 * potency)% poison damage reduction ⬥ Lantadyme - Increases timed potion durations by (0.5 * Potency)min ⬥ Fellstalk - Potency% increased chance for spawning elite mobs

​

docs.title: Prayer Powders
docs.text:
Powders ⬥ Each powder increases buff duration by 30 min, capping at 60 minutes ⬥ Any form of death results in losing your incense buffs Notable Powders ⬥ Penance - Restores points equal to 2.5% of damage received ⬥ Protection - 1 more item protected with Protect Item     • You can still only protect 5 items max

​

docs.title: Necromancy Talents
docs.text:
Necromancy Talents ⬥ These are separated into tiers.     • Tier unlocks require reaching soul checkpoints.     • Some unlocks require completing quests. ⬥ Talent points are required for each unlock     • These are unlocked by training necromancy through combat. Talents Tier 1 ⬥ Requires 1 soul and completion of Necromancy     • (with 2 ) Talents Tier 2 ⬥ Requires 50 souls     • Talents Tier 3 ⬥ Requires 400 souls     • Completion of Rune Mythos is required for all incantations.     • Talents Tier 4 ⬥ Requires 2000 souls     • Talents Tier 5 ⬥ Requires 4500 souls     • Incantations in tier 5 and 6 require Tomes of the Warlock     • Talents Tier 6 ⬥ Requires 8500 souls     • Talents Tier 7 ⬥ Requires 35000 souls     • Completion of The Temple at Senntisten is required for     •

​

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
This channel lists the general list of free and skilling upgrades.

​

docs.title: These are worth looking at before looking at style specific upgrade orders.
docs.text:
​

As prices change, updates occur, and knowledge expands, other unlocks may be added to this list at any time.

​

Feel free to ask in #pvm-help if unsure where upgrades are relevent for content that you do!

​

docs.title: Early Money Making
docs.text:
To make money to fund your skilling early on, it is recommended to do either Croesus or easy clue scrolls. However it is worth noting many of the skills listed here can be trained for a profit.

​

For a checklist version, visit the RS Wiki page at https://runescape.wiki/w/PvM_unlock_guide#Upgrade_order.

​

docs.title: Worth obtaining ASAP - Severe Hinderance to PvM without these
docs.text:
⬥ At least level 90 in your relevent combat style

⬥ Ring of Vigour - 50,000

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can convert into a passive after Extinction with a warped gem

⬥ Level 95 Prayer and The Temple at Senntisten quest for

⬥ Level 99 Herblore

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can boost from 99 to make Elder Overloads with the aid of pulse cores, and can request assistance to make

​

Style Specific:

⬥ Sunshine , Death's Swiftness

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These both come from the world wakes

⬥ Strength Skillcape - free!

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Primarily for extended Dismember duration.

​

docs.title: Work towards these after finishing tier 1 unlocks
docs.text:
⬥ Entry Level Perks

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to #perks for setups as well as cost

⬥ Berserker's Fury (56 Archaeology )

⬥ 112 Archaeology (refer to !relic ‎for setups)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Will need to use boosts to unlock 650 energy and certain relics.

⬥ Claim the Codex Ultimatus to unlock

⬥ 120 Necromancy (refer to #rs3-slayer for methods)

​

docs.title: Get these when you can
docs.text:
⬥ Summoning , notable milestones are:

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 45 for Hellhound

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 73 for Blood Reaver

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 87 for Nihils

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 90 for Kal'gerion Demon

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 96 for Ripper Demon

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use !familiar ‎to see where to use what familiar

⬥ Asylum Surgeon's Ring

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is a good all round ring for all styles.

⬥ Greater Dazing Shot (Ranged only)

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Costs 63,000,000 Shattered Anima

⬥ Zorgoth's Soul Ring (Necromancy only)

⬥ Berserker Auras - - 25,000 each

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Passively unlocked while bossing.

⬥ Mahjarrat aura - 3 x or 1000 x

⬥ Other relevent auras - - Require loyalty points, unlock when you can.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• is particularly good early into PvM before having access to and

​

docs.title: As soon as you are able to get these, get them.
docs.text:
⬥ Zuk Capes

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can kill Zuk 4 times in one style to get all the capes

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is usually recommended around t85 gear

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hardmode cape is not needed, and is mainly a quality of life upgrade

docs.title: Necromancy Specific Upgrades
docs.text:
Necromancy hosts a few upgrade paths which are not purchaseable, but impact how fast you will progress.

​

docs.title: Kili's Tasks
docs.text:
Upon reaching level 70 you have the option to choose your path between power and tank armour. Completing either branch allows you to create the weaponry.

​

⬥ For less experienced players it is suggested to take the tank armour path.

‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These tasks are easier albeit more time consuming, and will make obtaining T90 weapons easier.

⬥ Upgrading your armour is generally at a cost of delaying purchasing The First Necromancer armour

​

docs.title: Nexuses
docs.text:
Nexuses are items used in Necromancy that can store ectoplasm and necrotic runes , similar to rune pouches for Magic. However, unlike the pouch, a nexus can hold up to a maximum stack (2,147,483,647) of each necrotic rune. They can be worn in the ammunition slot.

​

The unattuned deathwarden nexus is crafted using the soul forge within the City of Um in the tier 60 section, requiring an ensouled bar, a silver bar and a cut sapphire. Before the deathwarden nexus can be used to store ectoplasm and necrotic runes, it must be attuned at the dark portal located in the City of Um.

​

Other nexuses like and offer different passive effects.

​

⬥ Common Mistakes to Avoid

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
This channel lists the general natural combat style progression template for players to follow.

Last Revised: 7 February 2025

​

docs.title: Before looking here, check #Free Upgrades.
docs.text:
​

Priorities can of course change depending on the content being done by the player. You should note that when you upgrade weapons, you can sell the weapon being upgraded to deduct cost from the new weapon.

​

If an item is not in the order it was deemed not worth buying.

​

As prices change, updates occur, and knowledge expands, the order is subject to change at any time.

​

Feel free to ask in #pvm-help for a tailored list for the content that you do!

​

docs.title: Early Money Making
docs.text:
To make money to fund your first style early on, it is recommended to do either Croesus or easy clue scrolls.

​

docs.title: Ranged Upgrade Order
docs.text:
This is a generalised order which assumes a starting point of T70 weapons and armour.

​

For further information on each upgrade check the relevant section in #armour-and-weapons, #perks and #perk-information, #permanent-unlocks, or #eof-specs.

​

For a checklist version, visit the RS Wiki page at https://runescape.wiki/w/PvM_unlock_guide#Upgrade_order.

​

If you would like specialised advice, ask in #pvm-help.

​
